[Secret Technique: Step 1]\nStart by calmly analyzing your opponent's motivation.\nIf your opponent is trying to kill you for economic reasons or reasons beyond their control, an appeal for "sympathy" can prove an effective weapon.

[Secret Technique: Step 2]
Here are some classic phrases you can use to appeal for sympathy.
1. "My sister is ill."
2. "All of my friends sacrificed themselves so I could live."
3. "My sister has been fashioned into an experimental weapon."
[Secret Technique: Step 3]\nStart by practicing those phrases until they come naturally.\nAfter you feel at home pleading for your life, try coming up with some phrases of your own.

[Secret Technique: Step 4]
Once you have your own arsenal of appeals for sympathy on hand, you'll finally understand just how much fun pleading for your life can be.
Okay. So now the hard part.
If your opponent is out for revenge against you, here's a technique you can use. Learn this, and you can beg for your life whenever you want using only your own two hands.
This staff is apparently a quality item with a bit of a history to it.\nIts catalyst has a suspicious glow, and its handle is so smooth that it feels as if it's about to absorb your hand.
But the power it possesses is not well understood.
Nothing really happens when you use it.\nNot to me, not to the people around me...
Strange.\nMy thoughts are so simple these days.\nOh, look! A spider! It's just like a fish.
Spinning, spinning, the spider dances.\nNimbly, nimbly, it twirls and twirls.
I desperately try to catch it.\nNimbly, nimbly, it twirls and twirls.
I finally managed to catch it,\nbut something about it seemed off.
Nimbly, nimbly, the man dances.\nDances and dances in the palm of someone's hand.

The region was home to a wicked clan of giants who would lay waste to human settlements.\nTo say the giants were more than a match for their human counterparts was an understatement. Indeed, even ten knights were not enough to best a single giant.

An unknown magical warrior despised the knights and proposed a duel.\n"Attack me with twenty knights of your choice," he said. When the magical warrior emerged victorious, all of the knights immediately conceded defeat.

Hearing tales of the warrior's heroism, the king had high hopes for him and formally requested that he defeat the giants.\nWhen the warrior asked the king for the giant-killing hammer that had been passed down through the royal family for generations, the king quickly agreed and entrusted him with the hammer.

Not long after that, the magical warrior appeared before the settlement... with the giants.\nIt seemed the warrior was in league with the giants all along, and was now set on pillaging his fellow humans.\nThe king had been tricked into giving his enemies the only means to defeat them.

Excavated from a king's grave, this artifact was presented to the patron of a scientific research team.\nIt was a bow made of gold.\nAn exceedingly wealthy king from the ancient world had the best craftsman of his era make it for him.
Dazzling brilliance...\nA sophisticated and beautiful form, it seized the souls of all who laid their eyes upon it.
One glimpse was enough.\nA single glimpse would put anybody under its spell.\nWith just one glimpse, you would want it. You would want it more than anything...

Upon seeing a servant try to touch the golden bow, the patron blurted out something in a strange voice and shot at him.\nThe bow, having not seen the light of day in centuries, entertained itself by making people fight over it.

There was once a man who was hopelessly bad at singing. Much to the irritation of all who knew him, he decided to become a minstrel, convinced that he was a star.\n"They're just jealous of me," he thought. "That's why they're so mean to me."

One day, the clumsy minstrel happened upon a woman working as a flower vendor.\nHe rushed up to her and tried to woo her with his harp.\nThe woman cracked a smile and said, "Thanks for scaring all the customers away!" And with that, she socked him in the jaw.

"If only I were a siren," he thought. "Then they'd listen!"
It was then he remembered that just such a siren lived on a nearby peninsula,
where her beautiful voice lured men to a grisly fate.
He departed to meet her...

The siren at the peninsula sang to the dejected man. Undaunted, he played his harp and sang a ballad of love in return.\nThe siren went mad and died in a fit of rage.\nThe townsfolk praised him as a hero for defeating the siren, though none could understand why their savior had such a look of bewilderment.
So that they would always be together,\nhe promised to put her before himself.
So that they would always be together,\nshe became one with him.

A perfectly safe place.
Nothing would be lost.
Nothing would be stolen.
A perfectly safe place.

But once inside, there was no coming out.
There was no getting her out.
When he realized he'd never touch her again,
it was already too late.
And that's how the two who became one became nothing at all.
A melancholy blade, dyed blue with emotion.
A melancholy maiden, whose scythe dyed everything in shades of misery.
Melancholy and misery were like joy to her. The sensation made her remember all the other purest forms of sorrow.
To make her dreams come true, her blade guided yet another life to a miserable end.\nShe vowed the blade would never go thirsty until the world was consumed by misery.
One glimpse at the sledge on the wall, and I couldn't take my eyes off it.\nI can't really explain why.\nI just felt that it was meant to be mine.

I really couldn't afford anything outside of daily necessities.\nSo naturally, visits to see the sledge became a part of my daily routine.\nAs if he could see into my heart, the shopkeeper suggested I sell my organs to pay for it.

Kidney, liver, lung, skin, eyes...
I sold everything I could live without.
Humans can lose a lot and still live, right?
There's still more than enough of me left.

Spleen, tongue, gall bladder, pancreas...
Each day became a struggle.
It's only a matter of time now.
All the others will come.
And then it will be my brain, my spinal cord...my heart...
There once was a nightmare that possessed a special power.\nMany humans came in pursuit of its fins.
It kept granting the humans' wishes.\nEach time, it would give a human a piece of its most precious body part.
Rumors spread, and in time, its once massive body grew smaller and smaller, until even swimming became an almost impossible task.
The nightmare lay on its side on the bottom of the sea.\nFrom the hollow depths of its memory, the creature remembered the happy days it once spent with an old friend, long since passed.
It was a minstrel who rescued me when I strayed from the others.
The food he brought me... I'm convinced he only did it as thanks for listening to his song.
I'd always listen to him at the same time and place, and eventually we became friends.\nBut he seemed to be getting weaker by the day.\nI knew I had to be the reason.
A poor man, it was clear that he had been using every coin he earned on me.\nHe eventually sold his prized violin and was reduced to singing with his frail voice.
Ultimately, they believed sacrificing yourself for others to be a wonderful thing, and both found fulfillment.
For example, realizing your good deed would never be repaid only makes you want to do it even more.
They met again in the afterlife. And when they did, the fins he gave the humans glistened as if they'd been filled with the happiness they shared.
As the warm glow filled the country, the humans realized that the nightmare had perished.\nThe day would eventually be declared a national holiday, filling the country with joy for years to come.

The hand that held mine was always covered in blood.\nThough we weren't related, he took custody of me, and before long it became clear he was neither a saint nor of sound mind.\nEven still, his hand was warm, so I didn't try to run.

Some years after he took me in,
I got involved in some shady work.
He grumbled about it like always, but he understood that it was necessary if I were to survive in a world like this.
After all, death is always two steps behind you.

"I thought I'd use you as a decoy, but I grew fond of you."
It felt like an era of my life ended in mere moments.
It was because I was a burden to him...
He began to tell me the truth as I stuck the knife in his bloody chest.

"A killer who puts others before himself never lives long. Don't be like me..."
Though his hand still held mine, it was losing its familiar warmth.
And while I knew it went against what he had just told me,
I turned my back on the enemy to go look for a doctor.
[Today at the Castle Gate]\nTwo guards. One of them was apparently a new recruit, recently posted.\nWelcome to the tedium of guarding a small castle.
[Today at the Castle Gate]\nAn ambassador from a neighboring country visited before noon. He left just before sunset.\nIt seemed kind of important. I wonder if something happened.

[Royal Intelligence Service Bureau]
The man who had been taking notes at the front gate of the castle has been arrested for falsifying information, and his notebook confiscated.
I'm convinced his brief descriptions contain coded information that could compromise our country.
I'd sooner die than let those goddamned spies infiltrate the castle gate!

[Royal Intelligence Service Bureau]
I can't find any coded information anywhere. Where did I go wrong?!
What's that? The castle has been surrounded by an army from a neighboring country? I couldn't care less! I've got to find those messages!
Ah, His Majesty the King? Oh? I'm to be punished for failing to gather intelligence on neighboring countries?
Don't waste my time! I need to find those coded messages! None shall pass the castle gates!
Q. Does it work on people who are naturally unintelligent?\nA. Yes, of course. It enhances the effectiveness of fact retention charms by several factors of ten.
Q. So you can use it with other charms?\nA. Yes. Not a problem.
Q. Should you remove it before bathing or bedtime?\nA. Not at all. The jewel is directly connected to your feelings, so think about what you want to do and go with your gut.

Q. After I gave this charm to my baby, he mastered every discipline by the age of ten. He then said he was "tired of it all" and killed himself. How will you take responsibility for this?\nA. As stated before, side effects may vary.

The achievement of your dearest dream rests atop tens of thousands of corpses.
What would you yell in a world where you were one of only two left?
Would you finally smile?
Would you lament the fact that it was all for naught?
We have come here again and again, hoping to see you wail in sadness in your final moments.
.........
.........
......

Case 1
The dolls surged into a single heap like a tidal wave.
On bookshelves of black and red stood a mountain of corpses, nary a soul among them.
Their limbs can no longer feel.
The simple wish to revive Him is the only thing that can make this body stir.
What happens after this fight matters not.
I now know what fate awaits me...

Case 2
How many times have I seen this scene play out?
I don't seem to understand the essence of it.
Since then, I've failed to collect all of the lifeforce I need.

It breaks my heart.
A beloved person in an imperfect world.
But now... I'm broken and can barely maintain my human form.

I grip the blade tightly.
Sharp pain and fresh blood along edge.
It makes me feel alive.
"I...will finish this."
—The end I choose when we meet will be a prayer for destruction.

Case 3
It was there from the start.
Before I knew it, I was dependent on it.
The mission to find the one who started this bloody, holy war.

"Was I the one who was truly confined?"

Whenever I feel like I'm closing in on the truth, it turns out to be nothing more than a mirage.

I finally managed to find the answers I sought, but when I did...
I was shattered by the seeming hopelessness of a dream that just wouldn't come true.
As frustrated as I am, I must—

The achievement of your dearest dream rests atop a hundred million victims.
What would you yell in a world where you were only one of two left?
Would you finally smile?
Would you lament when you learn the truth about justice?
We have come here again and again, hoping to see you wail in sadness in your final moments.
.........
.........
.........

Case 1
The man with the same appearance and voice as my master, who denounces my justice, consumes my despair for sustenance.
My white world thoughtlessly defiled.
Every time I swing the sword of justice there, the fragments of the mirror dig in even deeper.
I know the wounds are not enough to kill me.
But it's clear that it's only a matter of time before my justice turns into a darkness that consumes me completely.

Case 2
The flames that scorched the world turned white into red.
To see her looking back on her sins was almost like...

The day I vowed to be pure.
The day I decided to be just.
And the day where I touched upon my own essence.

"Was I the one who was most defiled?"
Somehow accepting this reality led my defiled self to the simplest of endings.
Case 3\nThis ending isn't so bad.\nThe rest is up to you...
You hear that lullaby everywhere.\nRead it in a gentle voice, and its lyrics speak of an ugly, crooked world.\nThe ideals he sought could be found within.

I knew there was nothing gentle about it.
I knew that, if all of his wishes came true, he would be quick to abandon me.
It was my lot in life.
The "contractual chains" that connect two people...
I thought that he'd eventually accept me if I continued to be what he wanted.\nIn the end, however, all I got for my part was the knowledge that I was "useless."
That's why I took up this spear—\nThat the day when I free myself from these "contractual chains" might come.\nAll I wanted was the power to confine him, to keep him to myself.
Vendor A\n"One Hundred Orcs and the Silver War Maiden"\nCurrently in stock!
Vendor B\n"The Fountain of the White Maiden and the Vines"\nA new edition due to popular demand!
Vendor C\n"Snow White's XXX Story"\nA new take on an old tale that really defies expectations!
I was lost in another dream.\nMy life story could be found in that world of rancid scents and discordant sounds.\n"I'm nothing more than a book defiled by nightmares. But...why? Why...?"

(Red Riding Hood)
"Oh, what big ears you have, Grandma!"

(Wolf)
...

(Red Riding Hood)
"Oh, what big eyes you have, Grandma!"

(Wolf)
...

(Red Riding Hood)
"Oh, what a big mouth you have, Grandma!"

(Wolf)
How did you know I'm not your granny...?

(Red Riding Hood)
"I mean, I didn't mean to break you.
I was just playing like always.
Grandma? Are you in there?
Hurry on out!"

With those words, she tore the wolf's belly open in a shower of blood.
Ugh!\nWhy do you keep following me?!\nYou're always in the way!

Listen. I killed your parents.
You know that, right?
You're of no use to me anymore, and you're in the way.
Got it?

...Behind an irritated Cinderella,
a young hound heroically fought to keep pace.
As she made her way up the steep mountain,
he suffered scrape after scrape in his desperate attempts to follow.
The young hound slept like an exhausted puppy in the afternoon.\nHer hand shaking, Cinders pulls the trigger.\nThe gentle murmurs are drowned out by the blast.
Grant me wisdom, Staff.\nGrandpa will scold me if you don't...
How incredibly cruel...\nMixing poison into the broth at a soup kitchen...
But it must be done.\nWith as much debt as I have,\nI've got no choice in the matter.
Umm... Excuse me... Do you need medicine?\nYou'll live if you take some.\nIt's all yours for the price of the organ of your choice.

"Hey there."
"Listen to the dream I had."
How annoying...
But if I let her talk, maybe she'll fall asleep.

"If talking helps you fall asleep, then knock yourself out."
With those words, Sleeping Beauty began to speak in a cheery voice.
"The partridge told me.
He said you were stepping on my dreams, and..."
Sure enough, a few words were all that were needed to put Sleeping Beauty into a deep slumber.\n"She looks just like me," I thought, as she let out a gentle yawn.

It's not like I hated her or anything.
Her sleeping form was as warm as could be.

...What were the two Sleeping
Beauties dreaming about?
It was a secret only they could know.

My heart overflows with love.
We were beginning to get lost in a way
in which we could never return from.
I received the aphrodisiac from a suspicious scientist.\nShe claimed that it would make even the most reluctant man come after me like a wild beast.\nThe thought made me quiver with excitement.
The only catch was that the medicine only worked on young men.\nI was personally interested in someone more refined, but if it'd really do as she said, I felt that it was at least worth a shot.
The medicine made from the blood of a Nightmare with unrestrained yearnings proved incredibly potent.\nWhen I injected the serum into a terrified boy, he rushed at me with desire.

Each and every one of the villager's young dreamers became men that day.
Love and grief go hand in hand.\nAlmost all have experienced\nthe tragic end to a fleeting love.
Encounters and grief go hand in hand,\nbecause a sad farewell awaits\nat the end of every meeting.

Anguish, despair, gloom, heartache, misery, sorrow...

The dirty, smelly room was lit with a cheap neon light. Inside were a man and a woman drying her black hair.\nThe man barked a bare-faced lie, and the woman blindly believed it.\nSad scenes such as these are common wherever you go.
The woman knew the man had been lying from the start.\nBut she lied to herself, insisting that\n"if you don't believe it's a lie, it won't be."
A luxurious dinner in a three star hotel.\nThe man treated the woman well until she let him have her body.\nAs their rendezvous lost its novelty, the man began to stray.

The woman, who had used her youth as a weapon,
was left with nothing after it faded away.
And so, she desperately clung to the man
with the part of her that he had loved most...
She clung to him and squeezed.

My father had the power to change something precious into something special, an ability which my proud mother often praised.\nHe was a blacksmith revered in the west, and I'd always regarded him with pride.

Once my father started working on a particular piece, he wouldn't let a living soul into his workshop. His own family was no exception.\nWhat he did must have taken an immense amount of concentration.\nI understood that much, as young as I was, and imagining him hard at work helped me resist my more childish impulses.

Having respected my father more than anyone else in the world, it was only natural that I would want to follow in his footsteps.
So when it was decided that I would become a live-in apprentice at a well-known workshop, I rushed home to tell him the news.
I was on top of the world that day.
That's how I ended up barging right into his workshop while he was busy working.

I witnessed my father at work for the first time.
What I saw was nothing like I had imagined countless times before. I was at a loss for words.
"Now, it's your turn."
It was the first words I'd heard out of him in forever.
Hearing that short sentence, I finally understood the price he paid for his abilities.

"A key imbued with incredibly strong...desire...will appear.
And I will need you to do work on it for me."
From the day I received these mysterious powers, I started hearing an unpleasant voice in my head.
I didn't exactly want to listen to it, but I felt compelled to do its bidding for whatever reason.

One day, the suspicious voice started telling me the secrets of the world.\nIt was a list of phenomena so bizarre that most people would never believe it.\nI didn't think I'd believe it, either, but after several hours, the words began to ring true, so I set out to find a workshop to do the voice's bidding.

I did as I was told and spent my days making magnificent weapons.
Important things were lost with each one I finished.
The sadness of losing things that brightened my world chipped away at my heart.
But I could not deny the rate at which my skills improved...
Even if it left me with a heart haunted by warped desires.

My wife of many years.
My son who loved and respected me so much.
My very best friend.
A beauty I was once passionately in love with.
I sacrificed all of the important things I could think of,
but I ultimately came up one short.
I knew what the last important thing was.
I said a few words of gratitude to the...precious things...I used as materials
and completed my task with one last swing.
An old woman walked with a staff that resembled a long tree branch.\n"That's not how you use a long stick," I told her,\nand I showed her the right way to play with one!

After I was done playing with the old woman, a greasy old man called out as if he also wanted to play.\nHe seemed proud of his "long stick" skills, which he felt obliged to show me, but really, I didn't think his backbone was all that long. Too bad.

Yet again, a man with a long stick stood before me.
His breathing was forced, and he kept yelling at me about something to do with getting revenge for the old woman.
Is today national Long Stick Day or something?
Beats me...

Day eventually turned to night.
I was alone again.
"Mine is the best 'long stick,'" I thought.
And with that, I grabbed my long stick, and gripped it tight so I'd never lose it.

The kind king was the pride of the entire kingdom.\nWitnessing him chat with the queen and princess always brought smiles to the faces of all who saw them.\nThe queen suffered from a serious illness, but the feisty princess never allowed her parents a single moment to give into despair.

Three winters later, tragedy struck at last.
The queen succumbed to her illness and died.
The king cried for a day and a night, but his tears dried at the princess' playful jests.
He could smile, so long as he still had her.
But if she were to die, who would be left to warm his heart and quiet his doubts?

The kingdom's darkest fears soon came to pass.
One day without warning, the princess succumbed to the same illness as her mother and died.
The king wept relentlessly.
It was then that he realized—
He had no family left to ease him with a smile.

So it was that he turned to an ominous ceremony.\nIf it meant he could get the smiles of his queen and princess back, he was willing to sacrifice everything.\nAnd from that day forth, this dark ritual was held in a prison...

Adherent's Note ①\nThe person with the strongest desire has power in this world, be they nightmares or otherwise.\nSo if nightmares were to fight one another, exactly how much desire do you think the final survivor would possess?
Adherent's Note ②\nIs it possible to create an energy that defies all scientific law?\nIn truth, the physical makeup of nightmares possesses properties that go way beyond our wildest imaginations.

Adherent's Note ③
My research has come to a standstill.
The phenomena occur too randomly. Such fluctuations in the findings are simply too great, and results supporting my hypothesis appear at a negligible rate.
However, the princess has resumed breathing.

Adherent's Note ④
I don't know if you can call this living or not...
But now it's your turn. Oh, how I yearn for you.
My queen, even if you won't have anything resembling a heart,
I'll at least get to see you move one more time.

Guard's Testimony ①
Thanks to the king's magnificent governance, the kingdom flourished, and the population swelled.
But a famine left
the kingdom on the verge of collapse.

Guard's Testimony ②
But then—around the time the princess fell ill, was it?
People started disappearing on dark, misty days.
My own son was among them...
Guard's Testimony ③\nThey say the king was performing rituals to resurrect the princess.

Guard's Testimony ④
Once I've made my preparations, I'll head for the prison, too.
It's my duty to figure out what exactly is going on in there—
Not just as a father, but as a loyal servant to the king...

There was once a sword that could cut anything in half.\nA band of adventures who struggled to defeat an evil dragon found the sword, and the swordsman among them used it to split the dragon clean in two.

The adventurers found treasures of gold and silver piled in the dragon's nest.\nIt was too much to carry on their own, so they left to get help. Consumed by greed, the swordsman cut the suspension bridge on the way back.\nHis companions fell to their deaths at the bottom of the ravine.
The swordsman kept the treasure for himself and became wealthy beyond imagining.\nBut one day, an anonymous letter claiming "I know what you did" arrived at his mansion.
The swordsman, consumed with paranoia, fell ill.\nOne day, he decided to cut all of his servants in half.\nHe was promptly arrested and beheaded with his own sword.

The people who lived in the region deified Mother Earth and lived in harmony with her.\nIn the great forest near their settlement stood Yggdrasil, a towering tree well over 1,000 years old where many of the people prayed.
One day, another clan came through the forest to invade.\nBut the forest sensed their evil intent and led them astray.\nExhausted, they eventually gave up and returned home.

In time, the people stopped showing gratitude to the great forest, and Yggdrasil was reduced to tinder.\nThe clan once again invaded, this time from another direction, and the people fled into the forest for refuge.\nThe clan was notorious for cutting the tendons of prisoners to prevent escape, and those they captured were treated no better than cattle.

A fire rose out of nowhere to burn the great forest to the ground. All of the inhabitants of the settlement were burned alive.\nThe clan left in a rage, their bounty once more stolen from them.\nAnd so the great forest spared its former worshippers once more.
The town had a capable sheriff who kept a crossbow in a holster on his hip.\n"I'll protect this town without ever having to use this," he declared.
Later that day, the bank was being robbed, and the sheriff rushed to the scene.\nHe threatened them with his crossbow. They turned tail and ran away.

The robbers broke into a jeweler's mansion and barricaded themselves inside.\nThe sheriff rushed to the scene and appeared before the robbers.\nRumors that he'd "never use his crossbow" finally reached the thieves' ears, making his threats no more than empty bluster.

Seeing the sheriff with crossbow in hand, one robber yelled, "Does that crossbow even shoot?!"\nAs they spoke, other officers broke through the back and tied up the robbers.\nThe sheriff smiled. "It doesn't need to."

The composer was a prodigy from birth, but abuse at the hands of his foster parents had made him so anxious that he lived a life of obscurity.\nNevertheless, a showman found the prodigy and offered him an incredible contract.\nThankful beyond words, the composer vowed that his new patron would not regret his kindness.

Thanks to the showman, the composer's songs started to sell, and his life of misfortune seemed to be finally behind him.\nHowever, a beautiful woman soon set her gaze upon his wealth, and did everything in her power to get between him and his manager.\nIt was on her advice that the composer canceled the contract with the showman to whom he had been so grateful.

After his lover sucked him dry of every last drop of talent, he gambled away what money remained and went bankrupt.
His lover wasted no time in leaving him for another man.
Realizing the error of his ways, he apologized to the showman.
"You had a lot to offer before. Now? You're just a shadow of your former self," said the showman, rejecting him.

The composer put everything he had left into a new composition, sent it to the showman, and locked himself in his bathroom.\nWhen he was seen next, his limbs had been cut with harp strings and he was bleeding to death in his bathtub.\nThe showman's "Last Work of a Tragic Prodigy" achieved unprecedented sales.

They understood.
They knew that the amount of evil in the world hadn't waned.
And yet, the ruler still
put criminals in prison...
A desperate, desperate attempt to avert everyone's eyes from the truth.
And yet, many with evil in their hearts roamed free.\n"There's no way to figure out who they are until they do something bad," it's said.
They mimic the good and are only increasing in numbers.\nDarkness spreads at an alarming rate, and soon will shroud the entire world.\nNone believe it will end peacefully.
When the chains of evil are finally broken.\nThat's when they'll realize the error of their ways.\n...The day the bells of demise echo across the land draws near.
Cowardly Trick I - Camouflage:\nHiding yourself and your intentions is a fundamental skill.\nTake them by surprise and leave them wallowing in the depths of their despair.
Cowardly Trick II - Info Manipulation:\nHumans are frail and weak.\nJust be sure to hide your excitement when you realize you're the only one who knows the truth.
Cowardly Trick III - Impression Manipulation:\nHumans have a hard time moving past a first impression.\nIf you were born an attractive woman, there can be no stronger weapon than this.

Cowardly Trick IV - Blocking Trade:
Controlling a large population is easy.
Starvation saps the dignity from a populace and can turn even the most pious man into a monster.
If used correctly, you can destroy an entire country without getting a single drop of blood on your hands.

There was once a prodigal son who leeched off his family.\nHis father gave him the family heirloom, a halberd, as a parting gift before disowning him. The prodigal son wandered aimlessly before eventually making up his mind to become a mercenary.\nBefore long, a war broke out. The son managed to convince the right people that he was an excellent officer and was hired for the task.

The prodigal son's unit was sent into a fearsome battle. The commanding officer was one of the first to die.\nJust when it seemed that surrender was the only remaining course of action, the second-in-command rallied the troops.\nIt was in that moment that the prodigal son decided to leech off of him.

After the war, the prodigal son was praised for his deeds and promoted to commanding officer.\nHis father was quick to welcome him back, opening the door for him to get money from his family once again.\nHis former commander had been promoted to general, taking his sycophantic subordinate with him.

The heirloom halberd was possessed by a spirit that had already been leeching the soul of the son for quite some time.\nHoping to siphon further success from the officer, the son pawned the heirloom for money he meant to use as a bribe.\nThis is how the parasitic halberd left its hosts in search of fresher prey.
What a glorious night.\nThe silver glow of the stardust sent my heart aflutter.
The stars in the blackened sky looked like a jewelry box had been spilled onto a velvet cloth.\nIf only that creamy, white light would shine forever.
It's a shame the moon loses its luster with the dawn.\nThe sun would have to be removed for the moon to ever prevail.

I used a spell to destroy the sun...
but when I did, the moon disappeared with it!
The earth devolved into a frozen hellscape. I suppose the cold will kill me soon enough.
I just wanted to see the moon in all her glory...

Me? I'm a torturer who takes his job very seriously.
We just nabbed the most notorious thief in all the land. The king has ordered that I make him betray the location of the treasure he stole, so I smashed his fingers one-by-one with a hammer.
He cried and screamed and revealed the hiding place.
I promptly strangled him and reported that he had died without talking.

On my day off, I went to the cave where the treasure was stashed.\nAfter looking around a bit, I finally discovered the trove...or so I thought. Instead of treasure, all I found was a locked chest. What else could I do but take it home?

Lacking other options, I took the chest to a locksmith and asked him to do what he could with the lock.\n"This is going to take a bit of time," the blacksmith said before heading into his workshop. I waited there for a while.\nWhen the door opened, the authorities came out and arrested me.

I was taken before the king. "You were working with him, weren't you? You killed him before he could talk!"
"I was only trying to steal the treasure!" My explanation only made a bad situation worse.
My fingers were smashed one-by-one with a giant hammer.
I writhed in pain as the hammer loomed above my head...
And with that, I said farewell to this world.

The man was born to be a murderer and killed as easily as he drew breath.\nHe was eventually captured and had the mark of the death branded upon his forehead.\nThe night before he was set to die, Death appeared with a scythe in hand and said, "Your life will end tomorrow."

"I'm innocent," the prisoner said. "I can't die like this... I know! Make me into a reaper. Do that, and I'll gather proof of my innocence."\nDeath sympathized with him, agreed to do what he asked, and handed him his scythe.

Now a proper reaper, the prisoner broke out of his cell and went on a killing spree.\nNot long after, he was captured by an archangel and imprisoned in heaven.\nThe night before he was set to die, an angel appeared with a scythe in hand and said, "Your life will end tomorrow."

"I'm innocent," the prisoner said. "I can't die like this. I know! Make me into an angel. Do that, and I'll gather proof of my innocence."\nPossessed of both the powers of heaven and hell, the convict continues his path of slaughter to this day.

A blacksmith collected molten metal from the depths of a volcano, crafted a sword, and named it the Sword of Burned Metal.\nHe gave it to an ambitious young man as a parting gift when he decided to leave town.

The young man later took part in a tournament at the capital. He fought bravely, even in the face of superior adversaries.\nA commanding officer was impressed with his valor and recommended that he be given command of a hundred men.

An insurrection broke out, and the young man led his unit into battle.
As soon as they arrived, enemy cavalry appeared before them and began to jeer.
The man was consumed with rage and rode off to meet them on his own.
His subordinates, mistaking his actions for an all-out attack, followed close behind.

The young man's unit found themselves totally exposed to the enemy's assault.\nUnable to fathom why the man would put his unit in such a vulnerable position, his second-in-command stabbed him in the back.\nWith the Sword of Burned Metal still in hand, the man fell to the ground, his blood boiling.

When the girl opened her eyes, she had no idea where she was. An icy sense of loss sunk into her chest. Though she couldn't say why, she was clutching a violin.\n"Such a warm melody..."\nThough she was sure she was playing it poorly, the sound of the strings was sweet and brought her solace.

The dragon village strictly forbade contact with humans.
So when the dragon saw the girl being attacked by thieves, he knew he should've flown away.
Alas, his heart compelled him to save her, breaking his people's sacred law.
"Why did I do that?"
That simple question seemed to have no simple answer.

That was how the girl and the dragon first met.
He had every intention of flying away as soon as the girl was safe, but he kept putting it off.
First until she got home.
Then until she found work...
He always found new reasons to stick around.

In time, he came to realize the real reason he stayed with her.
It was the truth that finally convinced him it was time to leave.
He had let his feelings for her grow too strong.
As a parting gift, he turned part of his own body into a violin and flew away.

[Artifact Research Section - Memorandum]
The imperial tank and catapult units are a risk that needs to be dealt with.
There's no two ways about it.
Developing artifacts will do more to strengthen our country than relying on heavy weapons.

[Artifact A Inquiry]\nImbued with a thunder spirit, Artifact A made short work of the imperial tank and catapult units by blasting them with lightning from above.\nIt served its purpose well, but some users have taken to using it to blow open the doors of vaults, shatter the locks of treasure chests, and other such unlawful actions.

[Artifact A Improvements]
We've restricted its use to military applications, and have begun making enhancements.
The artifact can now shoot lightning from a greater distance.
More importantly, we are confident it will no longer get into the hands of those who would abuse its powers.

[Artifact A Dash Questions]\nArtifact A / "Distant Spinel" has been reborn as a military weapon, but thieves have since stolen the blueprints for the weapon, using them to cause all manner of chaos.\nMeasures must be taken to combat this at once.

The universe continues to expand indefinitely, consuming heat in the process. At this rate, the Earth is facing a second ice age, one that is sure to destroy humanity.\nBut don't fret. The universe was born from "nothing," which means that the creation of an artificial universe is surely possible.
Hold on one second. I'll devise a formula for the creation of a new universe!\nＨΨ＝０\n...Huh. Perhaps I made some mistake earlier in the formula?
Ψ= [K + V]Ψ\n∂²Ψ/∂t=-ℏ²∇²Ψ/ 2m +VΨ\nNo, no. This still seems way off...

I must do whatever it takes to find the formula for the creation of a new universe!\nIf I don't, I'll never show those idiots who dared call me a third-rate physicist how wrong they are. To think those fools expelled me from the scientific community...\nDefine! Deduce! Progress! Connect! AAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!

The wizard went to the island where a reaper resided and stood on the precipice of hell.\nWhen he didn't come back, everyone thought him dead.\nSeveral years later, he emerged from an underground spring with a staff that could control the dead.

Now armed with the staff's gruesome abilities, the wizard stopped eating and rarely went out in the daylight.\nHe lost weight, turned pale, and began to look more and more like the lifeless beings he commanded.

Night after night, he roamed the streets.\nHis favorite spot was a cemetery on the outskirts of town. There, he would stand perfectly still and listen, his heart at peace with the world.\nHis heart overflowed with compassion for the many corpses buried underground.

As he was standing in the cemetery, the corpses began to rise from the ground.
"Come forth, my brethren!" He smiled, pointing his staff to the ground.
More and more corpses fought their way to the surface and crowded around him...
The next morning, his suffocated corpse was discovered among the rotten flesh, his face frozen in ecstasy.
Everything of substance is destined to crumble.\nThe same could be said for relationships.\nMy wife and I know that all too well.
My wife understood the demands of my work.\nStill, she was prepared to dedicate her life to me.
She knew just what to say when the day came.\n"Don't hold back," she said. "Just make sure there's no pain."

When you've been together for so long, you can speak volumes with just a look. She slowly closed her eyes and entrusted her body to me.\n...Though I had imagined how it would go countless times, I still failed to meet her demands.
We've all experienced it at least once...\nA love made extraordinary only because it was unrequited.\nThat's what she was to me.
Though I could feel my heart speaking out to hers,\nthe fact we couldn't pledge our vows tore me apart.
Even if form decays over time, my feelings did not. If anything, the fact that it never came to fruition only made my affection stronger with time.
I lost my beloved wife, and we were lucky enough to meet again.\nShe was the most precious person in the world to me...and that made her the perfect material for my work.

On realizing he was destined to never set foot on the firm ground of reality, he (she) was proud to delve into a sea of passive emptiness instead. His faith within this ocean merged with a false self to create imperceptible shackles of the psyche.

Egocentrism is the true nature of all living things. We decided to define her by this false self. We also made the choice to start researching the problems that arise when false reality meets other ridiculous assumptions accepted as "truth."

The deviation mentioned in the previous thesis is grounded in the self-isolating and self-centered nature of his ego. I've concluded that his protective instinct kicks in whenever self-preservation is required. In other words, the false assumptions he (she) accepts as "truth."

Ultimately, the collapse of his self-satisfying "perceived superiority" will close the gap between his ego and true self, and the self-suppression of the self-isolating ego will occur to a greater extent. He will try to forget and will fail, trapped in a cycle of self-preserving actions.
We're very sorry, teacher.\nWe forced you to do this for us.
Oh, I know.\nI know what supper's made from.
I first noticed it\nwhen I ate my big sister.\nShe might've looked different, but I still knew.
She was so, so tasty.\nAnd I loved my big brother even more.\nSo I really want to try tasting him.
I saw it.\nI saw teacher's body hanging at night.
I saw it.\nI saw my mommy cleaning up the place real fast.
I saw it.\nI saw my mommy cooking up teacher's body.
I ate it. I ate teacher's body.\nAnd I knew. Meat from human bodies is tasty.
I think I always knew.\nI knew the real reason you went crazy.
There weren't enough.\nNot enough kids died naturally.
So you started killing kids.\nFor the sake of the kids.

You died and I took your place.
I know just how you felt.
I think I've gone pretty crazy too.
I was spaced out all day again.
So spaced out that the food I got ran away.

Our motherland was never on good terms with its neighbors, constantly involved in one skirmish or another. But ever since that fateful day, our nation found itself in a position of inferiority. The pressure was crushing.\nWe learned through a spy's report that a new arms-development process had been delivered to the hands of an enemy nation. That is why our king summoned me. As a prominent arms developer, I would prove the perfect counter.

Under the king's patronage, I began applying myself to the development of new weapons.\nAs the war grew more intense, these arms were sent straight to the battlefield, complete with flaws. Yes, they exploded on our own troops and resulted in several casualties...\nBut our neighbors grew concerned and began to pull back.

Although war had been avoided, I proposed to the king that I continue to develop these weapons. We may have been saved by the instincts of our enemy, but we couldn't count on being so lucky again.\nThe king did not agree. "We must rescue the commoners who have been ravaged by war," he said, allocating none of his budget towards arms development.

How could our nation establish any permanent policy this way? I've thus resolved to display my new weapon right on Main Street when the king visits.
Its name? The Explosive Javelin.
Hah! Now this is sure to change even a mind as stubborn as his!
...N-No, my assistant! Wait! I've yet to make my final calibrations, you mustn't fiddle with—

A true hero, he had mastered every martial art. He now counseled the throne, putting everything he had into crushing the neighboring country's forces.\nBut the king was not one for excessive bloodshed, and opted instead to make peace with the enemy. So it was that the hero parted ways with the king in order to conquer his own path.

The hero's struggles bore fruit, and soon none could rival him. With the neighboring forces destroyed, he returned to banish his own king.\nHe declined the throne, however, instead becoming head of the military. It was his hand that would choose the next king, he who would become first in a line of figureheads.

The new king was a weak-willed, talentless ingrate. Eventually, his scheming retainers planned to remove the hero so as to take power for themselves. The idiot king believed their slander and tried to behead the hero. Left with no other option, the hero slayed both the king and his retainers, taking both the throne and the title of Conqueror for himself.

His favor with the people plummeted. A quick series of rebellions followed, each rising on the tail of the last. His allies folded easily, and he knew not what to do. Finding himself more alone than ever, he took to the battlefield and slew his enemies with a bellowing laugh.\nThe Conqueror will surely return one day, blade in hand.

The adventurers searched the ruins, where they discovered an exquisite jug.\nNext to it was a piece of parchment that read, "Here lies sealed the Jug of Death, a cursed and sacred treasure that ends the life of its holder."\nThey took both it and the parchment to a merchant and sold them off for a hefty sum.

A man who'd heard rumors of the jug bought it on the spot.
The butler to a noble family, he was engaged in an affair with his master's wife, and so he plotted to kill him.
"I found this for an incredible bargain," he told the master of the house, who gleefully took it from his hands to display in his bedchamber.
Yet the noble remained the very picture of health no matter how much time passed. Nothing seemed to threaten his wellbeing.
Annoyed, the butler snuck out with the jug and returned it to the merchant.

Another man bought the jug next.
A knight serving a provincial lord, he wished to visit divine punishment upon his master who so persecuted his subjects.
Yet he could not bring himself to kill the man to whom he once devoted his sword. Only a natural death would do.
He gave the jug as an offering to his lord, who gleefully took it from his hands to display in his parlor. Once again, this would-be victim remained in perfect health.
Disappointed, the knight resigned his post and returned to the countryside.

After being passed through countless hands, the jug was returned to the original merchant. Having witnessed its failure so many times, he decided to keep it for himself.
That night, his wife discovered his adulterous ways and sent him to the afterlife with a dagger between the ribs.
How could the merchant have known of the mysterious, unsolved deaths visited upon the noble with the unchaste wife and the greedy provincial lord?
Indeed, the Jug of Death's curse was as real as it was inscrutable.
Thou shalt not eat thy own kind.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 2: Verse 3
Thou shalt watch for rot and must never bring displeasure to others.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 3: Verse 1
Thou shalt not be dissolved in holy water.\nThou shalt not bend to the power of the cross.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 5: Verse 2
Nothing threatens the living more than celerity.\nTrain hard each and every day, and always be sure to give chase at maximum speed.\nScripture of the Dead, Miscellaneous Notes
It happened the very day I was presented with my new plaything.\nI had not received such a toy in awhile, and simply could not control my desires.
But when I searched for a partner, the men ran off when they saw me swinging the iron ball with one hand.\nWhy would they do such a thing? I wished only to quell the fire burning in my body.
...No. I understand why.\nI've heard what they call me behind my back.\nI doubt there are any men left willing to play with me now.
I slumped under the canopy with my now-useless iron ball, turning my gaze to the sky. A flawless full moon looked back down on me.\nI recalled the blissful days of my youth and wept.
The melody revives a slumbering past.\nA distant winter day... A time of happiness, now melted with the passage of time.
The moving music rose from the ashes of a distant past.
This melody I play must be filled with sorrow.\nThe memories of that day fill my heart to the brim, and I'd have it no other way.
I have no choice but to play these notes.\nIt's the only way to stop the shadows from engulfing me...\nTo stop the joy of that day from drowning me.
[Method #1]\nWait to approach when target begins to descend the stairs, then push them down. A simple maneuver, certainly, but lethality is not guaranteed.

[Method #2]\nFind a reason to accompany the target when they go on a long trip, then wait for the right moment to kick their horse from behind.\nThe shocked horse will run wild. High chance of broken neck if the horse decides to buck.

[Method #3]
Drip poison from the bedroom ceiling into target's mouth, day by day.
Enough accumulated in the body will deform blood vessels, causing sudden heart failure.
Requires determination, but it is both reliable and difficult to detect.

My hands tremble as they hold the notebook. This handwriting... Whose is it?\nI left the kitchen to question my servants. My heart throbbed, and I began to feel dizzy. Was Method #3 already underway? To think that I'd have to fear assassination for the rest of my life...

The man's plans to run a lumber mill had failed, and he now struggled with his debts. He wrote a note for his wife and child, packed a single bag, and left home. A large vein of gold had just been discovered in the countryside, and he would be among those flocking to it in hopes of getting lucky.

As fate would have it, the man ran across his debt collector on the way to the station.\nThe collector demanded he repay his debts, going so far as to threaten to sell off the man's wife and child if he didn't. This instilled in the man such a rage that he beat the collector to death. He realized that, were the body to be found, the debt collector's friends may try to exact revenge on his family. He therefore shredded the body in his lumber mill, stuffed it in his bag, and took it with him.

The man collapsed at the first inn he got too, finally able to relax. But just as he nodded off, he heard a knock at the door.
"We've received complaints of an unpleasant smell in here," the innkeeper said.
The man responded only with silence, and waited until the innkeeper left.
He tossed the corpse-filled bag out of the window with a weight attached, sending it to the bottom of the ocean.

One year later, the man struck gold, changing his life forever. He forgot about his old family, found a new wife, and indulged himself day after day.\nOne such day, a bureaucrat he'd invited to his lavish ship fished up an odd item. The man immediately recognized it as the bag he'd once thrown into the sea. Years of despair washed over him, a tidal wave of regret that had been building since the day he abandoned his home.

It was said the halberdier could pierce through the most robust of defenses and easily take the head of any enemy general.\nNone knew of his background, and rumors regarding his true identity spread like wildfire throughout the land.

A spy soon discovered that the halberdier was the agent of an enemy nation, and quickly moved to report these findings to his commander.\nWhen he told the soldier who stood guard outside their headquarters, the soldier replied, "Hrm... In that case, please keep what I am about to say a secret."

He continued, "The man stationed here is a body double. The real commander is already approaching the enemy via a secret route to carry out a night raid."\n"Why didn't you tell me that sooner?!" the spy rebuked him, running off in a panic.

With the spy gone, the soldier breathed a sigh of relief.\nHe ran off with his hidden halberd in one hand and a bag holding the commander's head in the other.\nThe halberdier had succeeded in taking out the commander.

A priest on a pilgrimage came across a village plagued by bandits.\n"How will things ever get better if you sit there and do nothing? Take up arms and chase them out!"\nRoused by the priest's words, the villagers took to battle and—incredibly enough—got rid of them all.

The priest was resting at a church during his pilgrimage when the pastor there came to speak with him in private.\nNo one was coming to holy day communion. The flame of his faith was all but extinguished. The priest reassured the pastor and held communion in his place.\nThe sermon he gave instilled the parish with fanatical fervor, and the church was packed beyond capacity thereafter.

The priest's sermons had the power to move the heart and stir the body.\nWord of his talents spread, and he rapidly climbed the church's ranks. He soon attained the position of archbishop. It wasn't long before he was summoned to see the Holy Father on his deathbed, where the priest was named his successor.

He used his status as the new Holy Father to add more and more believers to his flock. But the sermons that so moved the hearts of others soon began to twist his own.\n"It is I you should worship! Who but me could bestow such blessings upon you? I am unto a god!"\nHis followers took his heresy for what it was, and his attendant felled this false god with poisoned wine. He died as quickly as he'd risen.

There once was an archer of notoriously steady aim. Furthermore, he was an intellectual who preferred solitude to socializing. All agreed his skills were unmatched, as was his care for his bow. In fact, none but he were even allowed to touch it.

One day, the archer was challenged by a youth to a test of skill.
The youth went first, piercing a bird that rested atop a tree with his arrow.
The archer followed, shooting only the wings from a flying bird, thus grounding it without taking its life.
"Perhaps you noticed I shot with my left hand... I am actually right-handed. Shooting properly, I could hit that from five times the distance," the archer said leaving the youth trembling in humiliation.

The archer was eating at a pub one night during his travels when a man tried to snatch his bow. The archer, of course, stopped him with ease.\n"I...I was just trying to help my sick child. I thought to sell your bow to buy medicine..." The man continued on like this, but the archer ignored his pleas and handed him to the authorities.\nThe excuses of thieves did not concern him.

Some time later, a group of men who had suffered embarrassment at the hands of the archer hired a band of mercenaries to take revenge. They surrounded his lodgings in the middle of the night, but before they could act, arrows began to fly from the darkness. The men fell one after the other, and once all were slain, the archer jumped down from the roof, calm as ever.\nFrom that day on, he was revered as a living legend alongside his beloved bow, known only by the name "Absolute Zero."

The cardinal was a cultured man who loved music beyond all else. Indeed, even he himself was an adept flutist.\nOne day, he hired a nun to take care of the day-to-day business of the clergy, but there was one thing he didn't know.\nIn truth, the young nun so coveted the cardinal that she would often lick his flute in secret.

On a day like any other, the nun once more found herself overcome with lust and snuck into the cardinal's room.\nThere she found a houseboy running his tongue up and down the cardinal's flute.\nYes, this young man also bore deep carnal desires for the cardinal.

Her sacred object now sullied, the nun flew into a rage.\nShe grabbed a nearby vase and smashed it over the boy's head, murdering him before she could come to her senses.\nOvercome with guilt and shame, the nun leapt to her death...at least, that had been the plan. Instead, she found herself paralyzed from the neck down.

The cardinal had odd proclivities of his own.\nHe taught music to the wives of high-society families he would meet on his social trips, and he would swap his flute with theirs.\nThis simple act of deceit made him feel dominant and powerful, filling him with perverse pleasure...
