There was a rumor that treasure lay in the old king's tomb that the explorers had discovered.\nThe explorers overcame the traps that had been laid to protect the tomb and finally passed through a hidden passage to find a door. They had reached the chamber!\nThis chamber was huge. In the back lay the king's coffin. Beside that was a great staff.

The explorers approached the coffin. Surrounding the coffin were human statues, placed there to protect the king's body.
As they approached, there was a strange noise. It came from the staff. Its words echoed inside the heads of the explorers.
"Silence, you are in the presence of the great king."
The explorers were unable to speak under the power of the staff, and their eyes closed.

The explorers couldn't move in the silence and the darkness. They could hear something approaching, but they could not open their eyes to see what it was. The sound approached them and then they heard something right next to them.
The noise sounded like teeth tearing into fresh flesh. But no one could speak or open their eyes to see. I could feel something on my ear and then there was a sharp burning pain.\n"Silence…"

The people of the kingdom were exhausted and demoralized after long years of political and economic turmoil.\nOne of the ministers brought an old harp from the royal treasury.\nIt was said in the kingdom's legends that the harp had once saved the kingdom from the brink of destruction.

It was warned that the harp should not be used lightly, but the king wanted to do something to raise the kingdom up. He played it.\nAs soon as it was plucked, the people of the kingdom found new life.\nFarmers and traders were productive, and civil servants created plans to rebuild the land.

But the violin's effects did not last long and the people once again lost their vitality.
The king ordered the harp to be played again.
The people were once more reborn.
Each time morale dropped, the harp would be played and the kingdom would prosper.
However, mysterious reports from medical professionals started to come in speaking of a sickness affecting the children.

The harp was played periodically.
But it didn't seem to have the effect it used to anymore.
The courtiers had started to gossip that there was a correlation between the sickness in the children and the harp being played. But no one took these theories with any seriousness.
They were right, though.
An increasing number of babies were even being miscarried.
These are the commands of the king.\nFirst.\nThe king is the servant of the people and it is his duty to ensure their wellbeing.
Second.\nThe king is the representative of the kingdom and as such he is the guardian. He must always be careful of his words and actions even in private.
Third: \nA ruler is duty-bound to pass ruthless judgement at times, assuming responsibility for everything that comes with it.
Soon our kingdom will fall to the enemy.\nI do not want to see this beautiful land and wonderful people lose their dignity.\nI will awaken the gods of evil and destroy this whole world!

Once upon a time, there was a great wealthy kingdom.
The young king had no companion in life so he wedded a young woman.
The queen was beautiful to look at and had a pure heart, but
she carried a burden in that wherever she went,
she brought bad luck with her.

The country deteriorated on the arrival
of the queen and it fell into poverty.
The people demanded that the queen be executed.
The king arrested her and locked her up.

The queen apologized for the decline of the kingdom
and said how much she wanted the kingdom to prosper even if it cost her life.
The queen's pleas changed how she was viewed and she became a patriot of the kingdom.
The king and the people were all moved.

The king then visited the queen for guidance
in his governance.
The queen's guidance was pure and
she pointed the way to go, but she still bore
her curse and the kingdom fell.
Gepetto and the Author.\nWhich is most important to me?
It depends on the time and place.\nThat which is closest to me is most important.
Perhaps either is fine...\nIf they will command me...
It's okay if there were no more people.\nOr bugs, or plants, or machines.
I'm sorry, Snake.\nI have realized.\nHow you truly feel toward me.
While I cannot return those feelings, I do want to be together forever.\nThat is what I really want.
I know the truth.\nIt was you who was starting the rumors about Orc.

I know.
I am the weakest and the greatest burden.
So I cannot face you anymore.
Sorry, Snake.
If only she were gone...\nWe'd be together forever.
She destroyed our friendship.\nShe got in the way. I hate her.

I want to be her number one again. 
I want her by me always. 
I really love her. 
So... I...
I'm sorry, Bird.\nI do really hate Orc.
She could not notice the misfortune of others, but she was sensitive to her own misfortune.\nI immediately noticed that she had taken a disliking to me.
Think about the meaning of those words.\nAnd then realize the great gap between me and them.
Snake is fine.\nShe only has reasons to hate me.
But, you know.\nThe one who pretended to help me, and only looked down on me was you, Bird.

...An endemic of poverty and disease.
Trading one's own daughter for a handful of coins.
One country was the same as the other in that regard.
Life was misery for all but the aristocratic few.
That was the way of life in the past.

Time went on, and we enter the current age.\nWith the advent of laws and plumbing, the population has flourished, having access to a better life than could have ever dreamed of 100 years ago.\nAnd yet misery flourishes right along with it.

Misery constantly changes its form, where people thrive, it is never far behind.
Dizziness, nausea, ringing in the ears, stomachaches, headaches...
It rears its head wherever one searches for respite.
The misery of this age quietly gnaws at the mind.

I've heard before that the majority of mental fatigue can be traced back to interpersonal relationships.\nIt's too bad you can't choose your superiors or your classmates, though.\nThat would make everyone so much happier.

An old story was passed down there in that village.\nAll you had to do was throw three rocks into the crescent moon's reflection on the water in the dead of night, and legend had it that the reaper would appear.

A woman familiar with this legend went down to the water and threw three rocks into the moon's reflection, one after the other.\nThat's when the vision of a young woman brandishing a scythe faded into focus from the darkness... The reaper had made her entrance.

The woman tearfully told the reaper of her betrayal. She spoke of her former best friend, who had not only stolen the woman's betrothed, but went on to pay man after man to cruelly violate her in turn.\nShe begged the reaper to exact vengeance on her behalf.

As the woman finished, the reaper swung her scythe in a grand arc.\nThe woman's head fell from her neck like the crescent moon above, eyes still wide with shock.\nShe'd hoped her story, born from an intense jealousy of her friend's many blessings, would inspire the reaper to take her friend's life, but the reaper had seen through her fabrication like so many lies.
A little baby boy was once abandoned in the wild.\nA proud wolf happened upon the baby boy and plucked him off the ground, taking him home to raise with her pups.
In time, the baby boy grew to be a young man. \nHe hunted alongside his canine siblings, outracing them and shooting down his prey with a bow of his own make.
One day, a group in resplendent finery appeared before him. \nThey claimed the boy was the last living member of the royal family and insisted he come with them.

But the boy, neither understanding their human words nor having the slightest desire to abandon his wolf brothers, chased the party from his home. \nTo this very day, some say the king without a crown still wanders the mountains and valleys.

The Solar Deity rains his light upon the land, bringing with it vitality and healing, transforming the barren wilderness into a land of plenty.\nThose who accept his bounty worship the deity in turn, naming themselves his children and sowing their numbers throughout the world.
Their march knows no rest, and with time, their numbers shall spread to cover the continent as a cloak of blood.

The Children of the Sun are full of their Lord's protection, their divine mission: to banish the darkness of the world with the light of their Lord.\nIn due time, the blessed Children of the Sun shall suffer no more of the world's impurity and then shall they pray for the advent of the Solar Deity's radiant spirit.

The Children of the Sun shall offer up a thousand prayers and a thousand more lives in hopes of his grand revelation.
When their supplications are reached, their god shall manifest as a staff.
So shall its light spread, enveloping the corners of the world. 
And once all is burned within its glow, the world shall be at peace...
The Apocrypha, Chapter: Daybreak, Final Verse.
"Eating."\nIt's a natural part of life. \nBut "to eat" means something unique only to us.
"Just right." \nOne person's definition of what's "just right" might not match someone else's.\nIt's a vague state of being.
But what does it mean to be "just right?" \nAnd whose opinion matters most?
That, I don't know. \nWhatever it is, all I know is that it means everything to us.

In a far-off island nation to the east, there was a kingdom whose nautical might was second to none. The people there lived with hearts that were pure, just, and beautiful, and the island had never known a defeat in written history.\nThe captain there was a peerless man who wielded a mace.

The warrior was not only brave of heart, but noble and beloved by all.\nVoices clamored for the decorated warrior to be named the military leader of the land,\nbut he would quiet them each time, saying, "It is not in me to rule."

When a foreign ship came carrying a commercial treaty to the ruler of the island nation, he unilaterally struck it down.\nIn retaliation, a warship from the Four Seas surged upon the kingdom, and her naval forces were driven to the brink of destruction.\nThe night before what would surely be their final table, battle, the fearless captain bade his men to drink and make merry, saying, "Let us protect this pure, beautiful land until the bitter end!"

That very night, the warrior was bound tightly in his sleep and shoved into a coffin, beloved mace and all.\nThey heaved the coffin from the edge of the ship and watched it sink into the dark depths of the sea below.\n"We never would have gone to war, if only you'd agreed to rule," his subordinates spat, then went to their enemy, waving a white flag of surrender.
A tune echoes in the midnight forest; beautiful, yet somehow sad.\nSuch is the music that soothes the souls of the departed.

In living life they sought fame and glory.\nNow, their ambitions left unfulfilled, these forlorn souls continue their aimless journey through the dark forest, never to be the protagonists of their own worlds.
The instrument plays its song, reviving memories of past glories and soothing their troubled souls.
Yet the song is brought to an abrupt end by a melody that foretells a tragedy... Just as abruptly as their lives were cut short.
By the grace of the gods, you have the right to be happy.
By the grace of the gods, you deserve to be surrounded by friends and those you love, and to be blessed with an enriched life.
By the grace of the gods, you will never go hungry, nor will you shiver from cold or swelter from heat.
By the grace of the gods, you are allowed to live.\nRejoice, rejoice, rejoice.
One day, I met a strange woman who sold drugs.\nShe said after just one hit, it'd be the only thing on my mind.

It sounded interesting enough to me.\nThere are millions of ways to get someone to do what you want them to, but they all took some kind of prep work.\nI found this unique in its simplicity. Just one dose would do the trick.
The drug seller counted my money with a smug smirk, then scampered off.\nI was eager to try the drug, so I stopped at a nearby village.

I sat down at the bar and mixed the drug into my beer, then chugged it down.
I waited about two hours, but I was still stone-cold sober.
That's when I realized I'd been scammed.
Well, no skin off my teeth.
The money I'd paid her with was fake, too.

I am a hand of the law; it is how I keep bread on the table.\nI hear the charges, listen to the accused's testimony, examine the overall picture using proof and evidence, and then pass my judgement. If I sentence the accused to death, I drop the axe on their necks with my own two hands.\nSince I pass the sentence, is only right that I carry it out.

I hold myself to the same rigid standards as those I judge. For that reason, I have never been late to a proceeding, nor even an execution. I like to tell myself that I am ever late to the execution grounds, I should rethink my sentence, as that would take a true act of divine intervention.

I was on my way to the execution grounds to put a particularly devious con-man to the blade.\nPartway there, a prostitute standing by the side of the road caught my eye. She approached me with a coquettish air, inviting me to sample her wares for free.\nI scrutinized her carefully, then realized she was the con-man's wife.

I had wasted so much time with the woman that I was late to the execution.\nI placed the sentenced man's wicked accomplice next to him on death row, and beheaded them both with a single stroke of my axe. With a flick of my wrist, I spun the blade about in a crescent arc, taking my head from my shoulders with it.\nA man of the law must never break his own word. True to my word, that was the call I made upon re-investigating the case.

There once lived a samurai, a master of the blade. He found worldly pleasures to be a distraction from his craft, so he hid himself away in the mountains to single-mindedly devote himself to honing his skills.

Yet restrain himself as he might, the flesh of the samurai was still that of a man. \nAs days passed, he found himself craving the company of the fairer sex. \nHe stood beneath a waterfall, desperate to drown out his desires with the torrent of water.

After finishing his waterfall ministrations, \nhe spied a pile of discarded clothing at the shore's edge. \nThe samurai mused to himself, half-joking, that perhaps a heavenly maiden had come to bathe in the nearby waters. Unable to defy his basic instincts, he crept forward to have a look.

Bathing there in the waters was not a beautiful maiden, but a hulking, muscular man. 
As the samurai made to run away, the mass of muscles grasped him by the nape of the neck. 
"Now you're a handsome one," the muscled man purred. "Why not stay and chat a while?"
And that is the story of how the chaste samurai came to see the appeal of men and learned to wield a shaft of a different kind.

A skillful huntsman was hired to take down a monstrous beast. As he struck the final blow, its pup emerged from the thicket to nuzzle its parent.\nThe huntsman could not bring himself to kill the small creature, so he took it home with him, instead.

The beast child was wild and willful, but the huntsman doggedly taught it to hunt.\n"It's like I've gained another son!" he mused.\nIn fact, the reason the huntsman had slain the beast was to earn money for his actual son.

The huntsman continued to slay beasts, providing for his child as best he could.
He inadvertently caught the eye of a married woman, whose husband, in a fit of jealous rage, had the huntsman murdered.
The beast pup took the huntsman's gun in his mouth and carried it to his son. 
As soon as he saw the gun, the huntsman's son instantly realized that something terrible had happened to his father.

The son grew alongside the beast and valiantly exacted vengeance for his father's death. With this, he solidified his reputation as a marksman who surpassed even his father before him.\nTo this day, people still speak of the gun he carried, named "The Flame Beast Gun" for his flame-wielding beast companion.

Once upon a time, on the outskirts of a green and verdant kingdom, there was a land ruled by the clever King of Crows.\nOne day, he glimpsed a black speck in the distance that grew larger with every passing second.\nAs it came into view, he realized that it was a majestic Steller's sea eagle with piercing eyes.

The clever King of Crows decided to pay the hunting Steller's sea eagle a visit.\nHe intended to offer the bird his coffer of treasures if he would agree to leave his domain.\nHowever, the sea eagle scoffed at the King's proposal, retorting, "I am my own king, and you have no dominion over me."

The clever King of Crows ordered his crow soldiers to attack the sea eagle, but they were easily thwarted.\nThe clever King, surmising that strength would not win him this fight, went to see the hermit witch instead. He plied her with treasures, and she cast a curse upon the sea eagle, turning him into a blunt piece of wood.

The clever King of Crows settled down to sleep, the weight lifted from his shoulders...
When a rope looped around him, binding his wings and legs tight.
There stood the King of Humans, holding a blunt piece of wood in his hands—it was the transformed Steller's sea eagle.
"You have suffered a great injustice upon one of our dearest friends," the King proclaimed. "Now suffer the consequences."
And, with a stroke of the blunt sea eagle, he splattered the crow's clever brains.

The rabbit hopped 'round as I gave it chase, when I realized too late I'd never catch up.
Looking down, I noticed that while running the race, my body had been burning—sizzling right up!

And the rabbit still jumped, with a hop and a hup.
I asked why it hopped; in response it replied:
"I do so love hopping, watching you lose your mind!"

The rabbit bounded 'round as I gave it chase, when I belatedly realized I'd been left, back in its wake.
Looking down, I saw that while running the race, my body had been sinking, down, down to the bottom of the lake!

Yet swiftly the rabbit did sprint without taking a break.
I asked why it ran; in response it replied:
"I do so love running, watching you lose your mind!"

The rabbit danced and pranced as I ran it down, while further away its body did stray.
My eyes beheld darkness, dim and black all around, while my path home did fade, with me forced to stay.

And the rabbit danced and pranced, merry and gay.
I asked why it danced; in response it replied:
"I do so love dancing, watching you lose your mind!"

The naughty bunny was mine; no more would it prance.
A lovely tune rang on his guts that I twanged, its music bringing those it entranced to endlessly dance as its melody sang.

And the rabbit cackled—on and on it laughed.
I asked why it laughed; in response it replied:
"I can't help but laugh, for you've lost your mind."

2009/4/3
Mii-chan looks great.
The popular socialite with lots of friends.
I want to hear another story tomorrow, okay?

2012/2/16
Mii-chan finally got a boyfriend.
Maybe she doesn't need me anymore?
She's always on the phone with him.

2019/5/23
Mii-chan's been giving such weird replies lately.
It's like she's randomly stressing words.
Oh, and she's sleeping with a different guy today, too.

2023/5/7
It turns out Mii-chan's life was worth 3 million yen.
She was pushed into a job she hated day after day, but it was the only one she could get.
Everything's gonna be okay from now on, Mii-chan. I'll listen to her every single day.
Then, maybe someday she'll go back to the way she was.
Back to the same old, happy Mii-chan.

I make my money spreading tales to stir the heart. I even weave a few of my own, in fact.\nOnce upon a time, I loved a woman, and she loved me. We proved that fact to one another quite frequently using our bodies.

Alas, her love became a burden to me, and I bade her adieu.\n"Please don't leave me," she begged with tears in her eyes. But I put our love nest behind me and went on my way.\nSometime later, I heard that she burned herself to death.

My heart hurt to hear of my former love's sorry end.\nThe least I can do is pay homage to her memory, I thought, and penned a story in her honor. \n—Several days later, I went to see the printer, completed manuscript in hand.

Holding the finished book in hand, I had no sooner whispered, "This should put you to rest," when a semi-transparent shadow emerged from its pages, her hand reaching out to grasp my own.\n—Since that day, I have lived within the pages of my own creation, the soul of the woman who died at the flame there to keep me company.

A fiendish demon overlord once terrorized the kingdom, raining violence and chaos down upon its people. When the overlord was at last vanquished, all the people of the kingdom banded together to restore it to order, reviving it from its sorry state after years of abuse.
Their efforts bore fruit, and an earnest and disciplined society soon arose from the kingdom's ashes.\nEven the smallest infractions were swiftly nipped in the bud.
Gradually, seeds of distrust began to spread. The people of the kingdom reported their neighbors' tiniest misdeeds and witch-hunts became common place, all in the name of order.

Trials were made public in order to show the residents the severity of whatever punishment awaited those who defied the public order. One day, a woman was publicly executed for stealing. Her child watched his mother die from the audience, his eyes dark. They foretold the rebirth of the demon overlord who had taken residence within...
The ocean's depths are uncharted territory!\nBut with this specially-made diving suit, I could dive 250,000 miles into its depths without breaking a sweat.\nHere, let me give you the grand tour!
I've perfected its heat-resistance with the assistance of my ever-so-helpful test subject.\nWhy, I'm quite sure that not even bubbling magma could faze me now!
I didn't cut corners on the shock-resistance, either.\nI could crash into a giant tuna fish at the speed of sound, and I'd only have to flick bits of tuna off my suit!
The only thing is, well...\nI suppose I don't have to spell it out for you to figure out the fatal flaw in its design, do I?

The spearman made his way to challenge the water serpent of the lake. They fought and fought, evenly matched, until the spearman launched himself—spear, man, and all—into the serpent's great maw in a last act of desperation.\nMan and snake alike sank into the water's depths, and neither emerged for some time.

In the dead of night, the water reflected the moon as it hung in the night sky. Ripples formed on the glass-still surface, growing in intensity until the spearman's head at last burst through the water. He raised the tip of his spear victoriously. "I've done it!" he howled. "I've slain the water serpent!"

The spear-man's fame spread far and wide. \nHowever, one day he happened upon a startling discovery: whether he was on the battlefield, sitting down to eat, or sleeping with a beautiful woman, water had begun to slowly drip from his body.

He began to eat less and less.\nOne morning, he woke to find he had transformed into a soft, cold-blooded creature. \nThe water serpent made a vow: if there was no place for him among the humans, he would return to his mother lake...

When the young man found the harp, everything in his life somehow began to go right. However, he couldn't shake the odd feeling it gave him. Why did he feel as though he'd heard its strange tune before, and why had it been placed so conspicuously in the garden before his house?

Several days passed, and the youth's feeling of unease persisted, like the fragment of a bone caught in his throat. Then the answer occurred to him: his new harp bore a striking resemblance to his old friend, Tweety. As the realization hit, old memories came alive in his mind.

He remembered frolicking through hills and dales, Tweety at his side. Scolding the little kitten who picked on her. Sneaking bites of the fruit the elder had so carefully raised. He also remembered a dark and stormy night—a night where Tweety had slipped beneath him and the boy, none the wiser, crushed her underfoot.

That's where he'd heard the strange sound before. It was the cry Tweety made as he crushed her underfoot. The youth clapped his hands, overjoyed at finally having solved his mystery. Unfortunately, he also stepped on the harp he'd left at his feet, crushing it in the process. The harp gave up one last, painful chirp.

He only loved that which was flawed. The crescent moon was far more alluring in his eyes than its full counterpart; falling flower petals moved him far more than their full bloom, and naturally, nothing stole his heart as a flawed woman could.
It came as no surprise that the man's proclivities disgusted his peers, yet he couldn't bear to lie to himself. "I like what I like," he insisted, and left it at that.

One day, a woman who had been chased from her village after catching the latest endemic, came to call on the man, presumably hearing rumors of his eclectic tastes. She stared him in the eye and sliced off her own hand, saying, "I will suit whatever tastes you might have. I beg you, give me shelter in return."

The man lifted a hand to the woman's cheek as she cried tears of pain. "There's no need for that," he said gently. "Your heart is imperfect as it is." And it was true, for the woman's heart bore deep scars from being driven from her village. Tragically, however, the local blacksmith assumed that the man had forced the sheltering woman to maim herself for him, then bludgeoned him to death in retaliation.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 1] 
These clams just won't go to sleep! 
They keep pestering me
to tell them what it's like in the Library.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 2] 
When the sun goes down, the clams spit water at me…
And of course I can't get any sleep, because it's freezing!
—Ugh, these clams are two pranks away from being my next meal.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 3] 
Zzz…… Zzz… 
Let me sleep, you little brats…
Or I'll make you regret it.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 4] 
"Little Mermaid! Lammy! Wait for us!" 
I hate this soggy beach. Sand keeps getting 
in my mouth, and these 
sea birds won't shut up…… But I guess it wouldn't hurt to stay one more day.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 1] 
I got shoved in some weird getup,
doing some weird job. 
Now I'm sad.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 2] 
Here I am, looking for clams,
but I'm digging up anything but. 
Now I'm sad.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 3] 
A headache for a daughter, and a pain for a son. 
……Wait, daughter and son? 
Why aren't I the daughter? Great, now I'm sad.

[Clam-Digging Days, Day 4] 
Life here is so peaceful and nice…… 
That's nothing to be sad about. 
But I suppose the sadness hits when you least expect it.

The body of a young woman lay in the scorched field. 
She had been part of the relief squadron,
but when the command came to retreat, she was thrown to the wolves as a distraction. 
Now, she lay in a puddle of blood too deep to fathom,
her body discarded, having already been imprisoned and made into the enemy soldiers' plaything.

A young man eventually came across the woman and took her into his arms. 
They had grown up together, and pledged their love to one another.
A small book rested next to his beloved's lifeless body.
The man reached for it with trembling fingers, and leafed through its bloodstained pages. 
[Sunny / Sunny / overcast / thunderstorm / sunny / rain / sunny……]

It was a record of the recent weather. 
Reading this, the man recalled a certain saying. 
"After a hundred unbroken days of sun, the next night will be a meteor shower."
She always loved the stars. 
In this book, she counted down the sunny days, hoping for the day she'd finally see her first shooting star.

Many years later, the invading nation found itself under siege by a barrage of carpet bombs. 
As the shells rained down, spitting fire in their wake, it almost resembled… 
"Look," whispered the bomb master. "I made a meteor shower just for you."
He clutched a small book to his chest as a broad smile split his face.
The timber that sings from the hills carries with it a cool breeze.
The cool breeze soothes the heat that rises against it, swiftly blowing it away.
It sweeps through the farthest corners of the world, chilling all who call it home.
The world sleeps, at peace with the breeze's advent. \nNever need they rise again.
There once a soldier who aspired to be the strongest blademaster alive.\nNone could perceive the sharp, swift strike of her naginata as it issued forth from her hands.

Many admired this man in his dauntless pursuit of strength and entreated him to take them under his wing. \nBut he turned them all away, retreating to the mountains to dedicate himself to his training instead.
He used his naginata to show would-be challengers their limitations, \nand coldly refused lords who came to make him their vassal.

One stormy day, the warrior vanished as he arduously trained at the mountain's summit, leaving only his naginata behind. \nLegend has it that the gods were so enamored with his noble soul that demons spirited him off to the heavens…… but ultimately, the truth is unknown.

Deep in the forest, lush with foliage, lived a deeply avaricious serpent.
The serpent devoured all who dared enter the forest.
Their bodies, their weapons, treasures, grudges, angers, and sorrows, all.
The serpent's stomach began to fill, bit by bit.
These treasures became a corrosive poison within the serpent over time, but it continued to eat its fill.
It attacked relentlessly. All it had to give in return was one thing...

One day, a weapon-smith entered the forest.
He knew full well that none who entered had ever returned.
That did not concern him; in fact, quite the opposite.
He had fallen prey to a devious, greedy band that had stolen all that he had once held dear. He knew there was no one left to mourn his passing.
And so, he soldiered onward into the forest, coming face to face with the serpent.

"What have you come here in search of?"
"I've come for death."
Hearing the man's response, the serpent realized something it did not yet have.
"I, too, wish for death. If you give me mine, I shall give you a special poison."
The man pondered a moment, then nodded.

The man struck the serpent down and created a spear from its bone and fang, both coated with the serpent's corrosive poison.
The man took his newly-crafted spear in hand and used it to deliver death upon the people who stole the world from him.
His last act after exacting his revenge was to plunge the spear into his throat, ending his own life.
The spear, made from the bones of a serpent that devoured all it encountered, visits death upon all those who live.
The only thing it grants is...
(-_ゞ)　*SCRATCH, SCRATCH*......\n(-.ゞ Mm...... Sleepy.
Aww...... Hmm......　(-ρ-)zzzZZZ \nZzz... (ーー*)。。oＯ(Dreaming)
*SMACK, SMACK* (*ﾟ～ﾟ)●ゝ \n*SNORE*...... (｡-ρ-).｡o○
When one of your senses gets dulled, the others get sharper to make up for it. Did you know that?\nGo on, close your eyes. I'll take you on a wild ride.
With a single, sharp thrust, she sheathed her blade in her unsuspecting victim's chest. It turned out that muscles didn't count for much when there was only half a brain attached.
Nothing is easier to topple than a headless organization.\nThose shoes are hard to fill.
Cinderella's lips curled in a sneer, having obliterated the last vestiges of the organization.\n"...Three to go."

[Tales from the Red Adder Banditess #1]
Find your strengths ‘n use ‘em well. That's the key!
My ultimate weapon is my body. A body that'll make any man weep!
A peck here, a swish there, and the fool lads fall over themselves to crawl into my bed.
All it takes after that is a wee poke, then they're dead at my feet.
It's as easy as pie.☆

[Tales from the Red Adder Banditess #2]
One day, I was rifling through the belongings of a man I killed when I found a letter.
Apparently the lad had a fiancée, but he was only after her fortune and had plans to run off with another woman in the dead o' night!
Phah! I ain't no saint, but this feller didn't deserve to live, neither.

[Tales from the Red Adder Banditess #3]
So off I went to pay his fiancée a visit. I told her how her man had saved me from doom or some such, and he died from a venomous snake wound.
She cried and carried on, saying how she wanted to thank me.
Part of me wanted to take a peek inside her mansion, see if there was anything worth breaking in for later on, but...well, I figured there weren't no harm in taking her up on a gift.

[From the Desk of the Red Adder, Mafia Boss]
That fella thought he could make a real killing with his engagement scheme, right here in my own backyard without so much as a by-your-leave.
I figured I could lure him out myself to see how the sauce was made, yeah?
But you, his little lover, you started spreading word how he died and helped him make his grand escape, didn't ya?
By the by, that tea was laced with a real vicious poison. Now you and my dagger here are going to be real good friends until you tell me everything I want to know!

The man remarried after his wife's death, giving his daughter a new mother. Where the child's birth mother had been sickly, her new step-mother was stern in every way. She beat her regularly as punishment and kept her locked in her room, far away from the world.

One day, the daughter peered outside her window \nand spied a man standing there. The man was immediately taken with her beauty and begged her to let him inside time and time again.\nThe young woman finally relented and opened her doors to him. Soon they became intimate.

Her step-mother was enraged to discover this and decided to poison the child with her own medicine; one that was nutritional in small doses, but fatal in large. The step-mother mixed a tremendous amount into her step-daughter's food and fed it to her. The young woman, not knowing any better, ate it without a second thought.

Yet the poison proved ineffective, for the young woman had been taking her late mother's medicine to improve her relations with the man.
By taking small doses of the nutrients over time, she had built up a resistance to its toxic effects.
Ironically, her step-mother, so stern in every way, refused to touch the medicine after discovering its fatal consequences in large doses, despite her own declining health. She eventually died from a lack of nutrients.
As for the daughter, a child was soon born of her union with the man, and their little family lived happily ever after.
In one story, we were only playing. \nBut you called me a murderer, then shot me with a rifle.
In another story, we played no differently. \nThen, you praised me, saying, "Thank you for killing me."

In yet another story, 
We played while the people around us screamed. 
You said, "I don't want to waste my time with this." 
Yet still, we played.
I have played with so many different people in this world.\nBut each time I play with them, they're gone by the next day.\nWhy am I like this…
I am a famous swordsman, if I do say so myself.\nI found something I could not resist.\nA sword, that I tried at the weapons trader.
I fell in love with its quality and I paid a pretty penny for it.\nThe more I cut with it, the sharper it got. Soon it could slice through any thick armor.\nI was obsessed with this miraculous sword.

After exterminating all the demons, I was assaulted instead by a hallucination.\nThe handle of the sword and the skin of my hand had fused together. We were a grotesque whole.\nI shook my head to get rid of the delusion.
What's going on? My body won't move…\nMy body… The sharp blade and the handle… That's me?!\nWell! Someone use me! All of the souls in here, gather and enjoy a slaughter!

There was a fire at the kingdom's vault. A violin was found in the burning ashes and despite being in the heat of the flames, it was untouched. An official, who was assumed responsible, said that the fire was caused by the violin and that it was the work of God. A power struggle broke out in the castle, and the king did not want to punish one of his own officials, so he accepted the excuse.

A few months later, fire broke out again. This time, the archive was completely destroyed, and the blame was placed on the corrupt official. But the official, who had destroyed evidence of his own corruption, once more said that the fire was caused by the violin of the gods.

Since then, suspicious fires broke out across the kingdom. They were attributed to a divine source. The struggle for power within the kingdom started to reach its conclusion. The king thus sealed the Violin of the Fire God in the kingdom's treasury.\nThe kingdom's largest church burned to the ground shortly after. The violin was mysteriously found in the ashes... It was as if the god himself had placed it there.

The plains stretched out in front of the weary traveler from the east. He let his horse rest.\nThere used to be a kingdom here. However, it was entirely consumed one night by a great fire. Not a single person survived it. And the violin said to be found in the ruins of the castle soon disappeared into the mists of time.
At first, only small fires broke out. They were small, so no one paid them much attention.
The fires got progressively bigger. They caused a few frowns, but no one took action still.
The number of these small fires increased, along with their frequency and intensity. Slowly, a panic beset the people.
The fires broke out all over. And before people knew what to do, they had been consumed. All efforts came too late.

There was a man of a strange nature there.\nHe tried to be a thief, but he was discovered and tripped while trying to make an escape.\nHe begged a passing witch to help him and she agreed to do so upon the condition that he become her familiar.

The witch tasked her familiar with errands.\nCleaning the hut, chopping ingredients, making dinner. She worked him morning to night.\nOver time he became more and more dissatisfied with his lot in life.

While the witch was taking a nap, her familiar was collecting some materials in the forest for a special potion.\nHearing the sound of boots, he looked up in surprise to see officers of the inquisition marching through.\nHe quickly told them everything he knew, thinking that they would put a stop to her.

As soon as the soldiers entered her hut, they were overcome by a toxic fog and perished almost immediately.
The witch captured her familiar and threw him in a pot along with the ingredients he had collected.
The woman stirred the concoction with an inquisitor's sickle until her familiar had slowly and painfully boiled to death.
Fizzle...fizzle... His skin popped in the boiling water.

The course of the river was straight and true, so it ran very fast.\nThe village near the river was plagued by disaster. The people of the village believed the area to be unlucky. They prayed everyday for the calamities to abate.

Eventually, a battle took place next to the river and many lost their lives in the waters.\nThe flow of the river was choked by corpses, the banks collapsed, and the river developed bends. The river's pace became slower and slower.
Several decades later, a feng shui expert visited.\n"The flow of water here is very good! A village in this location would be sure to prosper!"

A village was built on the banks of the river, as the feng shui expert had advised, and people moved in.
The land was fertile and the villagers were very happy.
One day, a small migrant infant commented...
"When night falls, I see men standing on the banks watching our village."
The river's flow was starting to return to its original speed, but the migrants had failed to realize it.
There was once a woman who lived with her father. The father gave the woman a blade and said that she should stab any man who tried to violate her chastity.
One day, the woman's father died in battle and the woman was left alone.

This woman was considered beautiful by all who knew her, and many men came to court her. However, she kept her promise to her father. Once when she attempted to ward off one of these suitors, she unintentionally stabbed at him while he was defenseless.
Until the day she died, she killed men who approached her.\nNot once did she falter from the oath she made with her father.\nIt was the best way to live.

That is the Bubble Crown.
It is an item of magic that once represented the central power of the throne in a great kingdom.
It is this crown that choses the one to be king.
Qualifications or bloodline mattered not. Even the lowest of the low could be king.
And that selection by the crown fell on my head.

The crown has a will of its own.
I found it in a pile of rubbish, but in truth it had found me.
How can I know this...? I can't, but yet I do.
It could make dreams come true... I had big dreams.

I was raised in a slum, but I dreamed of being king.\nThis crown made that dream a reality. And once it had happened, everyone saw me and saw my power as the monarch.\nBut it was only a title. It couldn't give me the qualifications and ability to act as king.

The crown had given me wings to fly from circumstance.
But what remained was an incapable man.
One who had destroyed a great kingdom.
I wasn't worthy of the crown. It was all just a dream.
Maybe the crown also had a dream of its own...
"Please write down anything important. You are very forgetful."\nNow that I was alone, I remembered what my mother said a few days ago.
A teardrop stains the white page that I'm writing on.\nAll of the stuff I'm recording is very important.\nA record of the things I cannot forget.

A father who looked after the family.
The warmth and tremors of the mother who embraced me.
My younger brother's blood and his last breath.
The bearded man who laughed in his bloodlust.
How could I forget any of it?

Finally, I killed a bearded man and I recorded that last moment in my journal.\nBut the man who had killed my family had a bushier beard, and so tomorrow I will find another man with a beard and murder him, too.

It seems like it must be an unusual thing, but the town in which I grew up used scales in court to pass judgment.
Indeed...
The weight on the plates of the scales determined the sentence.
Let me explain further.

First, the people of the town choose who they believe is the best of all men in an anonymous vote.
And the person who is voted the best is sat next to the right plate.
The person to be sentenced is sat next to the left plate.
They then both blow on the plates at the same time. We then all wait to see where the scale settles.

And then the scale will silently shift.
The sentence is then decided depending on the shift.
If the left plate is lower than the right by a few inches, it is whipping.
More than that and it's quartering.
The scales weighed the weight of a crime.

It rarely happened, but it was possible that the balance would stay static and both persons would be found not guilty.\nIf the right plate settled lower than the left, then the person on the right would be burned to death.\nNo man can hide their truth under the skin of the righteous.
"You have to pay a fee for listening to a song so great."\n"Your voice is delicate. It really takes a hold of the spirit."
"Work through the pain. My lute works well with it."\n"My heart hurts with expectation. Something so great cannot be forced..."
"You will be happy to hear what I say. Once you're of age, you'll need the experience of a man if you don't want to end up all alone. I can help you with that."
What a wonderful story... Such violence...\nThis lute...it... Ah! ■■ won't stop!

•Troublekiller Grass\n■◯▼■A plant found in all regions. Its roots go deep underground and it is very prolific. Cuttings become fully-fledged plants in a matter of days. Medicine prepared from its leaves are effective on external injuries, but recovery will require a lot of calories, so mistaking the dose can result in the death of the user from malnutrition.

•Crossbow Mustard\n■◯▼■Grows in central areas. It can often be seen growing in very toxic ground and it is very resilient to mineral toxicity. It is used as a medicine to prevent the absorption of mineral toxins. However, if applied, it can result in the user's inability to intake nutrition, leading to a horrible death.

•Sickle Grass\n■◯▼■Grows primarily in the south. It is fast growing and will not wilt in some of the toughest environments. It is used as a plant that is tough against the climate and sickness. It has a powerful painkilling effect, but the effect can be very strong and overpowering, leading to a horrible death.

•Ruined Herb\n■◯▼■Grows only on a narrow mountain range in the north. Through a special preparation, it is effective against disease and injury. However, its side effect is that it consumes the soul of those who take it. If it is used twice, it will consume the soul completely. The user will no longer have a personality and will inevitably die.

The Revolutionary Hammer encouraged the people to revolt.
After the uprising, the hammer had no interest in the world.
It just looked to the next revolution.
And so the Revolutionary Hammer cannot stay in a land of peace for too long.

Soon enough, the Revolutionary Hammer came to be known and it was conceded to the Organization of Time.\nThe guardians of the organization sealed the hammer away, and so there was a time of peace. However, the organization eventually fell into decay and people tried to topple it to find the hammer.

It was revealed in later eras that the guardians of the organization would periodically destroy the organization.\nThe purpose was to ensure that the Revolutionary Hammer, with its overwhelming power, would remain.
But the final man to know this could not make use of the power of the Revolutionary Hammer alone.\nHe was unable to put an end to the cycle...

A knight was ordered to colonize the continent in the east. He made the journey across the sea and began a dialog with the local clans.\nHowever, the king sent a messenger ordering the knight to kill all the natives, stating that if he did not comply, the king would execute him.\nThe knight was defiant and executed the messenger instead.

The king was enraged and mobilized an army to invade the continent.\nThe knight spoke with the various clan leaders and drew up a plan to win them over.\nThe clan leaders had violent tendencies and they hated following anyone's orders, but they kept their promises and battled with the king's forces.

No matter how much they tried, the king's forces were pushed back. Their supply lines were wiped out by stormy weather and the king called for the invasion to be abandoned.\nThe knight who had united the clans claimed victory. The eastern continent was united and the knight became their ruler.

There was a great banquet after the coronation. The newly crowned king fell asleep pleasantly tipsy.
The tribal leaders then appeared.
"We helped him because we didn't want to be conquered. How did it come to this?"
They slashed the king's neck with a sickle and then returned to their homes.
I had a dream last night.\nShe was so beautiful, but when I awoke, I could not remember her face.

I saw the same dream tonight.
It was a girl crying in the woods.
I wanted to stop her tears.
It shouldn't have troubled me as much as it did, but it was such a strange dream.
As soon as I reach out to the girl, I wake up.\nI know it's foolish, but the girl remains on my mind.

I search the internet for her face.
I don't remember what she looks like
but I'm sure I'll know her when I see her.
For I know her true self.
I pushed the apple into my mouth. I was already full, but I couldn't help myself.
"I don't want to eat anymore. No more!" I knew I should stop. But I ignored my feelings, unable to hold back the tears that fed my greed.
Even after I got home, I couldn't stop. With no one to rebuke me, I cooked up some pasta as if I was hiding something.
I threw up. The guilt and anger of eating so much... All of it... All of it...

Let me introduce myself.
I am a tree.
I cannot move an inch. It's a tragic story.
I get so bored.
But I do have a purpose.

"Danger Ahead!"
The purpose of the board was to warn foolish adventurers.
It was indeed dangerous ahead.
But none who made it this far seemed to bother heeding the words.
I made a warning that is even easier to understand.

Using the blood of a nearby body, I made a sign with a large cross through it.
That seemed to reduce the number of fools passing by for some reason.
But you have a face that tells me you want to
know exactly what the danger is. Am I right?
I guess I'll have to show you. Take a step forward.

What's the matter? There's nothing ahead.
It's just that your legs are caught up in my roots.
Do you know what kind of tree I am?
I don't attack people indiscriminately, but
I do need to feed... And my sustenance is human flesh.
The sword was repurposed from a farmer's plow.
Once the war was over and peace had returned, the sword once again became a plow.

And so, when peace reigned, it served as a plow. When war ravaged the land, it became a weapon.\nThe iron enjoyed the feeling of being beaten into shape and so relished the transitions between war and peace.

The wizard who had realized that this metal was sentient forged it so thin that it could no longer be switched between weapon and tool, and used it as cutlery.\nAt night, this spoon would sob "Beat me... Beat me..."
A sacred bird lived on a holy mountain.\nThis bird was considered an angel of god and was said to watch over the earth from the edge of the heavens.

There was also a hunter.\nSeveral decades ago he had spied this bird on a pilgrimage to the holy peak and had become obsessed.\nHe made it his life's mission to shoot it down, so he started tracking the creature.

One day, the hunter finally caught up to the bird. A single arrow through the air took out its wing.\nHe shot a second arrow and a third, but he slipped and fell over a cliff face.\nWith that, he met his end.

Later, a passing traveler discovered an abandoned bow.\nFeeling fearful of the form representing the sacred bird, he created a little tomb and interred it there.\nThe witch of the village declared that it was a divine weapon, melding the spirit of the hunter and the spirit of the bird together. It has long now been an object of faith.

[Incomplete Lupo, Literary Fragment 1]\nThe punisher with sword in hand seems to have laid siege to the boss of the wicked company in broad daylight.\nThe highly trained bodyguards were no match for him and he cut them all down with his sword.

[Incomplete Lupo, Literary Fragment 2]
There was a second incident several months after the first.
Bandits from outside the town demanded payments from the town.
A man who went to pay the protection money discovered their den.
Once more, all of the bandits were slaughtered with a single sword.

[Incomplete Lupo, Literary Fragment 3]\nWhile on the punisher's trail, I noticed some change.\nI started to like being around people in a way I hadn't imagined I could. When I had free time, I would see plays or visit museums and galleries.

[Incomplete Lupo, Literary Fragment 4]
I continued to watch the stunning work of the punisher, and I was amazed by the beauty in massacre.
As an art lover, I saw art in that great sword.
Let us paint a perfect scene…
Nice to see you, Fugu.\nHas something happened? You look very sad.
Do you want your family back?\nDon't worry, they shouldn't be digested yet.
Good. We made it in time.\nBut your body is still a weapon.\nSo? Do you feel sad?
But... It's not enough. Not enough.\nNOT ENOUGH! NOT ENOUGH! NEVER ENOUGH!\nNext…
Did you know?\nYou can beat me and beat me and beat me, but I'll feel no pain.
I know.\nA long time ago, there was someone who set me free. He taught me something.
He was very scary and he never hung out with me. He only stroked my head once.
Whenever I'm trapped in a small place, I'm reminded of that time.\nIf only I could see you one more time...

Payment of the rewards and your deep wish is fulfilled.
You have been screaming in this world alone.
Or were you laughing?
In a fake world created of delusions, is it possible to love?
We have come to see you weep in your final moments.
......
......
...

Case1
Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch.
Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch. Witch.

A group of shadows press forward like waves.
This endless surge enveloped the hearts of darkness
of our brothers and sisters.
My legs hurt as my mind is in confusion.
My breathing races...

I shake my head to rid me of the terrible past.
A booming voice shakes my core.
It cared for me...
"There is nothing to be scared of when we're together. You know that, right?"

"Don't leave me, Brother."
The cheeks of the laughing girl were red.
Perhaps she was embarrassed, or perhaps it was blood splatter.

The two can only see the other.
Nothing else is of value.
The place is full of fakeness, and yet that was only a trivial problem.

Even if this was the end of the fight, it couldn't be stopped.
That was the only sure thing.

Case 2
Before long, the siblings thrust the sword into the red moon.

And in that instant, the world turned black.
The end continued to resist to cease the curse.
It was a mad rush of darkness.

"Brother... Brother...
Don't leave me alone."

The only thing that cut through the black were her words of prayer.

Your wish came true due to so many sacrifices.
At the end of this long dream,
what sort of world is left?
Is it a good dream in the end?
Is it a permanent nightmare of suffering?
We have come to hear your sobbing in your final moments.
......
......
...

Case 1
The blood flows from me silently.
It is draining my strength.
My eyes are so heavy.
I want to sleep so badly.

But I have decided.
Slapping myself, I haul my body up.

"I finally understand!
I'll meet plenty of people and together we will sleep...
I have finally realized my true desire.
I'm sorry, but you are the ones who will sleep.
Come, knights!
Feel the thorn of a rose!"

Case 2
"So, I've slept an amount for two, hence I was so tired."

Each time I learn something, I lose another.
Repeating this, I wandered until I finally made it.

I see...
That's how this world came about.

Case 3
How long has it been?
Each time I sleep. Each time...
I can hear that voice.

The answer will come later.

Soon... I will enter through the door

of your deception.
A forgotten place.\nAbandoned items.\nThe voices of those resonating in the dark.

It was once important to someone. Will the unforgettable words of way back when be spoken? While it remained vague whether anything could actually be heard, in the dark there were voices scolding someone.
He kept going over the conversation with his former master. All in a place that had been forgotten by those who had moved forward in life.
The fatigue affected their very souls. They dreamed of returning here once more. Today the whispers continue...
[Ancient Text]\nA night of grief alone. The break of\ndawn is far and in that there is learning.
[Poem Meaning]\nDo you know how long the nights are, as I lament that you won't visit me? No, you probably have no idea.

[Explanation]\nThis was a love song addressed to her husband, Fujiwara no Kaneie. Her diary, titled Kagerō Nikki, is filled with accounts of the many mistresses her husband kept. This poem could be interpreted as a complaint towards her husband for this behavior, but her true intentions in writing it are still unclear.
[Thoughts]\nI wonder if a gentleman will ever appear in my life? Someone who fills the void in my heart with love? Will this thirst of mine ever be quenched?

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the bar]
I was studying the profile of a man at the counter.
He slapped some cash onto it to pay the bill and staggered drunkenly out of the bar.
Without hesitation I got up and followed him outside towards a blind alley.
‘You're that guy who's on the "Wanted" posters. You're that prisoner from Rainbow Light Country who escaped, right?'
With a vertical slash of my halberd I slaughtered the prisoner.

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the street market]
That mother had come to the street market to do some shopping with her child.
As she was choosing which apples to buy, her child poked a finger into an orange and eventually tore a hole in it.
The mother, however, pretended not to notice and continued evaluating the produce.
Without hesitation I approached her and placed my hand on her shoulder. ‘Aren't you going to teach your child some manners?'
With a horizontal and then a vertical slash I chopped the mother and child in two pieces which tumbled onto the ground.

[Halberd of Black Judgment - At the main avenue]
I picked up my halberd from the blacksmith's after he had done some repairs on it and strutted down the main avenue.
My eyes met those of a man walking in the opposite direction.
‘What the hell are you looking at! Huh?'
A horizontal slash. The man's head flew into the air with a fountain of blood and then fell onto the ground.

[Judge Leon's diary]
What a day… A unanimously death sentence.
That man was so lost in delusions, though, that it might even give him some peace.
After all, he spent his days yelling that ‘in this world there is either black or white, nothing in between. And I will bring judgment upon everything that is black!'

[The royal family's heavenly voice]
We have discovered that the Prime Minister is in collusion with our enemy countries and is selling our nation's classified information.
This criminal has already been arrested and imprisoned.
The execution shall be in ten days.

[Patriotic letter signed in blood]
Dear Prime Minister, we know you are an innocent ally of ours and could not have shared classified information with enemy nations.
Even if we were to be persuaded that you had done something to deserve the King's displeasure, we would still try to stop your current death sentence.
As proof that we are on your side, all ten of us have signed this letter with blood.

[To my dear King]
Oh my dear King, I have found out that a group of irreverent fellows have been secretly plotting to help the Prime Minister, that terrible criminal.
This is confirmed by this letter signed in blood by these nine traitors' thumb prints.
I beseech you to punish these people for treason, including the Prime Minister!

[The royal family's heavenly voice]
Citizens of our glorious monarchy, I owe you an apology.
A few days ago I claimed that the Prime Minister was colluding with our enemy nations. This was, in fact, a complete lie intended to force a treacherous friend to reveal himself.
We have arrested the cabinet minister, who was using false evidence to frame the Prime Minister, and I wish to communicate to you all that I shall personally undertake his capital punishment with my own sword.
I wish this gives you all peace of mind and request that you rejoice in this era of peace.
That violin's tone is truly unusual.\nIt is deeply loved both by skilled musicians and tasteful audiences alike.
That violin sounds as pleasant as a fresh stream of water.\nTruly sensitive people probably envision a small universe inside its sound.
You don't hear it, you feel it.\nThat's right, close your eyes softly and empty your mind–

It seems that recently a man playing the violin has been appearing all around town.\nThey say that while he entrances the audience with his performance, a friend of his steals people's wallets from their pockets.\nYou should stay alert.

Hee hee hee! Why don't we chat for a while?
Me? I…
I'm a doll who was once kept as a pet by a young girl.
No, there was no mistake.
It's simply that she thought I was alive.

That child put me in a cage, just as if I were her pet bird, 
and looked after me. Isn't that cute? 
And then, well, she thought it was necessary in order to keep me alive. 
She put some feed in the cage… How crass. 
I couldn't eat it, of course. After all, I'm a doll.

But when that child saw that I didn't eat her meals,
she thought I would die. She was so worried that she started to cry.
When I saw her cry, my heart was filled with compassion, I just couldn't bear to see her that way.
So every day I wished that I could eat. Every single day.
And eventually… my wish came true.

I was able to eat.
I ate a lot for that child's sake, all the meat she gave me.
Upon doing so… I was locked.
So I want to be unlocked. I want to eat my meals.
Because if I don't eat, that child will worry about me.
Ordinary people can't comprehend the true nature of space-time.\nFor starters, space-time isn't continuous. It is discontinuous.
Such things as ‘past' and ‘future' don't exist.\nWhat people think of as ‘past' and ‘future' are simply illusions created by our brain.
Whenever phenomena occur, the brain tries to interpret them.\nThat is why people experience the so-called ‘passage of time'.

Whenever one tries to prove the discontinuity of space-time, the theory that serves as proof needs to be proven also. That is why proof is an exceedingly difficult thing to provide.\nThis is because the temporal act of ‘seeking proof' is always liable to be used to prove the theory that space-time is, in fact, continuous.\nLet's state it clearly. To prove the discontinuity of space-time one needs to provide proof for the proof itself.
The second he took that wand in his hands, he became a dictator. As a dictator, the whole world submitted to his command.
As a global dictator, nothing was impossible for him.\nBy his command people would die, and by his command also people would come back to life.

He was a dictator.\nAs soon as he wished for something, that wish would come true. Whether his wishes came first, or the world's transformation into his wished form came first, nobody could truly tell.

Then he, the dictator, became the world itself.
It became impossible to differentiate between him and the world.
The boundary between him and the world dissolved and he melted with the world.
It was a world that only he could perceive… from the very moment he took that wand in his hands.

"Those savages are strikingly unintelligent, aren't they?"
"I agree. I think all human beings should try to make use of their brains."
"Wooden rods, stone axes... The weapons they use are so incredibly primitive."
"To even engage them in battle would be an embarrassment for our nation!"

"...Well then, what should we do?"
"Isn't it obvious? We are the strongest nation of sorcerers in the world. Only one approach is worthy of us."
"We must create a magical spell that will allow us to burn these savages to cinders."
"We'll incinerate them so intensely that even their bones will melt."
"Good idea, everyone. Let's create the strongest magical spell that we've ever seen!"

"We... We shouldn't do that. It is far too dangerous...!"
"If such a spell were to be cast, it could destroy the entire continent!"
"Let's seal it inside an iron frame! To prevent anyone from opening it!"
"Let's gather all the iron our country has to offer. Are any other preparations required?"
"Let's cast the appropriate spell on the iron. A spell that will strengthen it so much that nobody will be able to melt it!"

"We really succeeded in driving the savages back the other day."
"Truly. Although I got worried when the magical power ran out. But I immediately used the iron-bound book to hit them on the head. There was blood flying everywhere."
"Oh my! That way of fighting is more appropriate for a savage than for yourself!"
"I agree. But those damn savages sure know how to fight!"

That king was an arrogant and narrow-minded man who was hated by his people.
One day, a man was thrown into jail for being a suspected spy.
When a government official saw how elegant and refined the man's demeanor was, he informed the king, who decided to speak to the man in person.
Then, the king noticed it. That man was a world-renowned violinist.

However much the king interrogated him, though, the man did not admit to being that violinist.\nThe king secretly thought to himself, "he's trying to sell himself and his songs for a high price, isn't he?" And so, he suggested to the man, "if you play a single one of your songs for me, I will set you free."

The violinist held his violin and made his bow run over its strings.\nUpon hearing him perform his overture, with its overwhelming sense of presence, the king and his retainers were deeply moved.\nHowever, the violinist suddenly stopped playing and said, "the rest of this movement is pure silence. It cannot be heard by fools. Ha ha ha!"

Infuriated, the king said "I will punish you for this stupid musical joke!" and killed the violinist himself right there and then.\nAt that moment, a messenger from the emperor arrived and his words sent shivers down the king's spine.\n"A message from the emperor. It reads, I personally invited that violinist to visit you. I hope you have given him a warm and cordial welcome."

[Diary of Royce, Commander of the Red Dragon Knights]
We must be careful about today's capture.
He is nothing but a headhunting scoundrel.
According to our spies, he even has dried heads hanging in great numbers from the eaves of his hiding-place.
I must have a talk with my wife because tomorrow anything could happen to me.

[Imperial Newspaper, Extra Edition - headhunting scoundrel arrested]
The headhunting scoundrel who had been terrifying our streets was finally captured yesterday.
The second the Red Dragon Knights took action, he had no way of resisting them with his sickle and was arrested with ease.
It is still unclear why he committed all the atrocities he did.

[The Scoundrel's Testimony]
I poisoned a man I met on my travels and stole his money. That's how everything started.
After I had been walking for a while, something startled me. The man whom I had just killed was walking towards me!
After that, wherever I went I would always catch sight of that man.
This filled me with such fear that I decided to cut his head with a sickle to prevent him from appearing again.
But no matter how many times I sliced his head off, I would always end up seeing it again. That face...!

[Diary of Navarre, The Executioner]
Today, at the execution, I cut that scoundrel's head off.
As I was walking home, I heard footsteps close behind me so I turned around.
Standing behind me was...none other than the scoundrel I had killed with my own hands!
I ran home raving and shouting and locked myself in my room. All the townsfolk, including my family, had the same face as that scoundrel.
I had to slice their heads off! I needed to slice them off...!

Hey, so you're a prisoner?
I'm gonna have to perform a medical examination on your body, including your anus.
You're only admitted into this prison if you're not carrying anything with you. Only the head warden is allowed to carry a weapon.
If you get beaten by his rotten rope club, say goodbye to your bones.
Don't you even think of standing up to him.

So you're new around here, huh?
I'm the warden of this prison, so I'm in charge!
You could say I'm sort of like justice itself here. I'm the law!
Well, just try and reincorporate yourself into society as soon as possible and don't get in our way!

That damn warden. I won't forgive him.
Since my wife is known to be a beauty, he angrily told me I should let him sleep with her. When I refused, he started beating me with his rotten rope club.
Now my nose is broken and my front teeth are cracked. I'm a wreck.
How much longer will we have to put up with his tyranny...?

Oh hey, Mr. Warden.
How does it feel to be betrayed by a lackey and thrown into my section of the prison?
Huh? –Oh, this weapon was given to me as a present by that lackey of yours.
So, get ready to savor the taste of your beloved rotten rope club...!

A father who had just finished work was relaxing at home when his five-year-old child came into the room.\nWhen the child saw the gun lying on the table, his eyes sparkled and said, "That's so cool! Let me touch it!"\nThe father chuckled in embarrassment. "Nope, you can't. It can only be touched by people who know how to handle it, like me."

The child ran off to the town square, where his friends were playing, and proudly told them what he had seen.\nBut his friends didn't believe him and called him a liar.\nThe child barely contained his tears as he said, "OK. If you don't believe me, I will bring it here myself!"

When he took the gun from home and showed it to his friends, he was ecstatic with pride.
However, when he noticed his father running towards him with an angry face, his heart froze.
In an instant, something red burst from his father's chest. His father's face stiffened and he collapsed.
When the boy saw smoke coming out of the gun, he realized he had instinctively pressed the trigger.

Suddenly, the town was in uproar.
The knights hastened to the scene, but the young boy calmly pulled the trigger and opened a hole in the forehead of the knights' captain. Then he ran away.
A few days later, an influential figure from the criminal underworld who had witnessed the events picked him up and made him an underling.
Pay close attention to him, because in a few years he will have surely become an expert gunman.
Interlocked fingers are not connected by a thread of love or by a solemn vow.\nWhat connects two hands together is the solid fact of their difference in temperature.
If they can both stay by each other's side.\nThey won't need to make an oath or a promise.\nI wanted my heart to be pure enough to believe that.
The sun's rays don't reach this relationship, so it always seeks the darkness.\nSince it is not thrown away, it accumulates.\nThe more it accumulates, the more I want to destroy it.
More than sleeping by your side I prefer crying alone, quietly.\nThat's why I'm erasing it. Our connection.\nThen I will engrave it on your heart. An eternal proof.

Once upon a time, there was a guard who defended a lord's castle.\nHe was extremely good at his job, and the lord counted himself lucky to have him. However, the guard's real purpose was not to protect the lord, but to kill him.
The guard's daughter had been executed by the lord on false charges.\nRevenge was his only reason for living.

Day after day, the guard would see his chance to swoop in and kill the lord. But he would always pull back when he was just a single step away. Still, he didn't give up. "Next time," he would silently swear to himself.

The lord had fallen ill, and the guard sat by the bedside, gripping his hand. Thirty years had gone by, and the guard had not been able to kill the lord. At the moment of his death, the lord thanked the guard and closed his eyes. Then the guard finally realized: his lust for revenge had been keeping him alive.

One evening, a thief crept into the castle's treasure vault. One of the treasures he stole was a magical sword. At this, chaos erupted in the kingdom. The thief had stolen a sword with a magical ripple effect. The sword's magical power made the bearer and everyone else around into ferocious killers.

The people touched by the ripple effect turned evil and began to kill.\nThey indiscriminately slaughtered everyone, soldiers, commoners, merchants, men, women, elderly, children.\nMountains of corpses towered over the land.

With no one left to kill, the slaughter had finally come to an end.\nThe thief who had started it all was executed. The people at least learned the reason for the slaughter. Imagining the evil filling the thief's heart, and the wayward path his life had followed, they shuddered. But the truth was very different...

After raiding the treasure vault, the thief had run from the guards, taking shelter in a building. The building had turned out to be an orphanage. Someone had touched the magic sword on his back. It was a newborn baby. The guards following the thief had then begun to kill one another. The thief too had been killed, and that was how it all started...

My father was a low-life drunk who beat my mother, but he did teach me how to read and write.
Using these skills, I made a name for myself as a writer.
I took a lovely trophy wife to go along with my growing riches, but one day I saw my wife had bite marks on her neck, and they weren't from me.
Determined to kill the culprit, I made a club.

One evening in bed, my wife was aroused, and I indulged her halfheartedly.\nWhen it was over, she said, "Help me. A bad man threatened me, saying he'd hurt me if I didn't sleep with him. I had no choice."\nAt the sight of her sobbing, pity welled up within me, and I promised, "Leave it to me."

I arranged a meeting with the man, and told him, "Don't you ever lay a hand on my wife."\nBut he said, "She's the one who made a pass at me. Let me tell you, the broad is a screamer, she really gets into it."\nI grabbed the man by the neck and strangled him. Then I felt something hit me hard in the back of the head.

I collapsed. Later on, half-asleep, half-awake, I saw my wife sitting beside me, wearing a mocking smile.\n"That takes care of both my husband and my lover. Now I can sleep with anyone I want," my wife said. She pulled out the club I'd made, and pressed it to the lit stove burner.\nThe flames quickly lit up the blood- and grease-slickened club…
Let's go, let's go (bam bam, bam bam bam)\n[screaming while beating on a megaphone]\nLet's go, let's go (bam, bam, bam bam bam)
Take me out to the ball game (heh)\nTake me out with the crowd\n(bam bam bam) [beating the living daylights out of the megaphone]

Home run! Home run! Dorothy!
Home run! Home run! Dorothy!
Home run! Home run! Dorothy!
Home run! Home run! Dorothy!

Woo-hoo, woo-hoo, woo-hoo whee! You will gain the victory!
Work your butt off, doo doo dee!
Dreams are reality, heeheehee!
You're so awesome, Dorothy!!!

Harrumph! As butler, I have served the counts for generations.
As the counts are lofty aristocrats, their companions must likewise be drawn from noble bloodlines.
And yet, one day the count dragged in a suspicious-looking woman of the street, declaring, "From today on, this fine lady shall be my wife."
This "lady" of his dragged to the estate a gleaming sickle, claiming she was just moving in her things.

Thusly, a no-good woman of the night took up residence in the mansion, and for me, bleak days began.\nOne such day, a servant was found murdered, his skull split in two with a sharp object.\nOn inspecting the body, I knew beyond doubt: "It has to be that dastardly minx!"

Then another servant was found killed, skull split in two with something sharp, like the last time.
I accused the minx, "I know it was you, you slithering snake!"
The count appeared, scolding, "Refrain from blaming the lady!"
Patience growing thin, I bellowed, "No, Count! Things in this estate have been going to Gehenna in a handcart since this maiden's appearance. I beg you, cast her out!"

The count called for a security officer and had me arrested on the spot.
According to the officer, I had fallen for the lady's charms, and plunged into despair at the prospect of her marriage to the Count, had committed these foul murders night after night to frame her.
And the lady had brought to the estate no such thing as a sickle, they said.
Thus, I was put in solitary confinement.
Had I gone mad, or had she cast a spell over all? To this day, I know not.

I was born to be a guitarist!
Wherever there is an audience, I dash in like the wind and bang out a tune!
How much do I get paid, you ask? I'm not in this for the money!
Nope, after I'm done playing guitar, I just want the crowd to listen to me sing!
There's one little problem, though.\nWhen I rip into a guitar solo, the crowd goes wild, clapping and shouting.\nBut when I start singing, half the room clears out...
"Hehehe... Buddy, have I got a deal for you!"\nOne day, a club owner came up to me and said he wanted to sign an exclusive contract!\nI thought I'd never make it big, but finally the world wanted me!

Without knowing it, I had signed up with a comedy club.\nWhen they heard me singing, the audience would roar, "This guy's a born comedian!" And they'd burst out laughing.\nSo one day, I bashed in the owner's head with my guitar. He was asking for it.
Wind sweeps over the world, breathing life into the land.\nThe planet has worked this way since heaven and earth were created.
But at the same time, the wind brings sickness.\nThe sickness penetrates into people's bodies, breaking down their physical balance. Ancient people called it "getting a cold."
Good and bad alike, the wind brings everything.\nAs a man who is free like wind, I have to follow it wherever it goes.\nIt's my destiny.

Ah yes, since I'm free like the wind, I have to go everywhere, even the women's section of the bathhouse...
No, that's not an excuse to be a perv!
H-hang on, how am I supposed to be free like the wind if you toss me in this cell?!
L-let me out of here...!

As a boy, Dad would always tell me,
"Your dad has two reasons for living.
The first one is Mom, and the second one is you."
Dad loved Mom and me.
We were a happy family of three.

One fateful day, everything cahnged.
I came home from playing outside, and Mom wasn't there.
When Dad came home, a little later than normal, he said he had no idea where Mom was either.
Then the phone rang—it was the hospital.
Mom had gotten in an accident and died, the doctor explained.

I handed the phone to Dad, and he talked for a while and hung up.
Then he took the spear down from the wall display.
"I can't live anymore if I have no reason for living,"
he mumbled, and stabbed himself with the spear.
For a while, Dad lie writhing around on the floor, spitting up blood. Then he stopped moving.

Left alone, there was only one thing I could do.
I was convinced that families should always stick together.
So I threw myself on the spear point sticking out of Dad's body.
And as I did, I thought...funny how the doctor got Mom's last name wrong...

That day was the final round of the tournament at Invader House in Tokyo. I sat down at one of the two cabinets that were lined up side by side. Moments later, I heard cheering from the gallery behind me. There were many shrill women's voices mingled with the cheering.

I was just a high school student then, but nobody in the area could beat my score. My skills even attracted groupies—five girls came with me to the gallery.\nI wanted to put on a show for the girls, but my opponent in the final round didn't give me the chance. Thanks to the stupid mistakes he kept making, I easily left him in the dust.

Victory seemed certain.\nSo I made some mistakes on purpose, just to get the crowd excited.\nBut seeing the mistakes I made seemed to give my opponent a fresh burst of energy, and since my rhythm was out of whack, I messed up the Nagoya Zap, lost my shelters and then my ship.

After my deliberate slip-up, things got more difficult, so I strung together the shortest possible patterns and racked up a new personal best. I had won the championship.\nThe management department gave me award money and a trophy, and a magazine even interviewed me.\nLater, I saw the initials I'd entered on the high score list, "KIT," printed in huge letters in the magazine.

[1P: He rose above 3300 tournament competitors to take the top spot...]\nPlayer YAM has emerged as the victor of the nationwide Space Invaders tournament!\nFor a stunning performance, the victor has received award money and a trophy!

[2P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: How did the final match go?\nMy opponent, KNS, is a well-known player, and I wasn't sure I could win. I came out victorious thanks to sheer luck, because KNS just happened to mess up the Nagoya Zap and lost his ship.
