[3P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: Which part of the tournament made the biggest impression on you?\nA: My friend KIT who entered the tournament with me had to go the hospital with a collapsed lung before the preliminaries started. To be honest, he's a better player than me, and it was a shame he had to drop out.

[4P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: How will you spend your award money?\nA: This is a little embarrassing to talk about, but I made a girlfriend at the tournament, so I'm going to use it to take her on a date [laughs].
I narrowed my eyes in the dazzling morning sun.\nI saw you sitting there on the bed.\n"Good morning, Big Brother," you said with a smile.
I loved seeing that smile on your face.\nI loved seeing you bathed in orange sunlight.
No matter how you might change, no matter how old I might get...
I'll never forgot this memory.\nI'll keep it in my mind forever...\nThat's what I thought back then.
The girl was possessed by a demon, so she spent her days alone in a barn.\nThe only companions the lonely girl had were the animals that lived there. She would spend her days talking to them.
The girl was frightened of the "humans" in the outside world. She hardly even knew her own mother. The animals were her only support in life.

The mother pitied the poor girl more than anyone. Every day, she would go to church to pray for her daughter. One day, there was a miracle. A shaft of light shone down in the stable, driving out the demon that possessed the girl.

The mother was overjoyed, but the girl was miserable. The demon had been her friend.\nWith a broken heart, she would speak to the demon in the depths of her memory, crying out her dead friend's name again and again.
A bloody war broke out.\nThe vanquished king with the crest of nine circles was sentenced to death by beheading, and his head was left at the execution grounds.

Several hundred years later, the king with the crest of the hibiscus, who had defeated the king with the crest of nine circles, was dethroned.
The new government severed the king's head and tossed it away—in the very same place where the king with the crest of nine circles had been beheaded.
For a long time, the two heads stayed silent.
But 200 years later, the head of the king with the crest of nine circles spoke.

"Today's monarchy is a mess. The king and the ministers are only out to enrich themselves, and the people are suffering."
"Is that so?"
"Don't you think we should do something?"
"I heard that you, the king with the crest of nine circles, were just such a monarch. And that's why you fought against me. But I wasn't as high-minded as you. I just wanted to be king."

"But now that I think about it, I realize you had me beheaded because you were just like how I used to be, young and arrogant. Not that there's any point blabbing about it now..."
"Well then..."
"It's a pain to keep on looking out for the kingdom when you're dead, but even so, we have to act."
The two heads put their heads together and came up with a plan.
Dark clouds filled the sky over the capital, where a flag with three stars was fluttering. Flashes of lightning burst from the clouds, the rolls of thunder growing louder...
Their pursuers caught up with them, and one man among them who was called the Servant of God blew his flute.\nWater spurted from the flute.
The stream of water from the flute of the Servant of God flooded the land all around.\nTheir pursuers drowned in the flood.\nBut the water would not stop gushing.
Then the Servant of God was swept away by the flood, and the people had no way to stop the flute from gushing water.
The muddy water washed away everything, scrubbing the land clean, leaving behind only the flute.
Things were tough when I was a kid.\nI didn't know how to deal with these impulses that kept grabbing hold of me.
My childhood was amazing.\nI would walk along at night with no goal in mind, and beasts would jump out from all sides to greet me violently.
I got a little older and learned more about the world.\nI started to understand that the same sex didn't appreciate it when I acted out my impulses.
So I learned to live the way I do now.\nThese days, in the information age, I can pretty much fulfill my needs online.\nI've realized how easy it is to find anything on the internet.
"Soon there will be nothing left of this village.\nA disease from another kingdom has infected this place, turning people into beasts, devouring everything."

The last words of the woman in the black cloak were, "Get out of this village as soon as you can, before the sickness devours you." Then she ran away as fast as her legs would carry her. I took a close look at the village, and noticed there were three types of people.

Pathetic village people who knew nothing. People who understood everything, in search of a way to coexist with their one-time brethren who had changed completely. People searching for a new, peaceful place before the disease could destroy them... Maybe none of the three were right.

There was an answer.
Before the disease could spread any further, everyone had to be killed.
"What a terrible, sad story..."
My murmured voice had a desolate ring, as if soaked by cold rain.
There is something strange about the village this Halloween.\nTake a walk through the village, and you won't see any children anywhere.
Well, you may see some, but there are shockingly few.\nAnd there are almost no old people either.\nA village with only young adults...there seems to be something else going on.
All the people are the same height.\nThere are only a few different hairstyles.\nThe leaders of the village must rule the place with an iron fist.

Normally the village leader would take charge.\nPeople who rule others with such authority usually make themselves conspicuous. That's what I thought, but—is it true?\nI'm not sure, but what I do know is, there's something fishy going on.
What do you want with me?\nHoho, you want revenge. Not a bad answer.\nI sense destiny has brought us together. After all, you could have chosen anyone.
To my bearer, I grant inhuman strength.\nWith my aid, you will easily obtain the blood-soaked revenge you seek.
But as payment, your soul will be mine for all eternity.\nWhen you perish, you will not be admitted into God's kingdom.\nYou will dwell in the inferno as the devil's slave. Is this what you desire?

Oh, what's that? You say I would gain more by letting you keep your soul and claiming those of the men you kill?
Hahaha, few dare negotiate with me. I admire your gall.
As you wish. Let the greedful pact be sealed!
Swing me, and let me savor the sweet taste of human souls!

Magical Familiar Contract\nArticle 1\nThe Magical Familiar Contract shall be carried out with both parties' consent. Forced servitude may be resisted through any means. Signer is responsible for all harm resulting thereon.

Article 2\n Following the execution of the Contract, compensation shall be paid upon each instance of servitude. Compensation shall consist of granting whatever the Familiar desires. Payments through magic shall be increased by twenty percent.

Article 3\nIn the event that Familiar dies due to negligence or mishandling by Attendant, Attendant shall expend the magical power/vitality necessary to revive Familiar. Rights to material benefits resulting from Familiar's powers revert to Signer.

Article 4\nIn the event of a contractual violation by Signer, Familiar may devour Signer's soul and/or body. In the event of a contractual violation by Familiar, Signer obtains Familiar's power and soul. Subsequent rebellion by said soul does not constitute a contractual violation.

"Hmm. Due to a family situation, Tomoki
has transferred schools."
It was a lie.
Even I knew that.
There was definitely something strange about him.\nSo of course I was happy.\nIf it was obvious enough that even I could see it, it had to be really bad.

From the first time we talked, there was something strange about him.
"Hey, show me your $%^{."
"I'm too embarrassed."
"It's okay. I won't laugh. So show me."
When ordered to do something, I never disobeyed.\nThat's the way my mother raised me. From the beginning, Tomoki knew that.\nSo he took advantage of my weakness...
"You look just like her."\n"Like who?"\n"My daughter."
Three days earlier, the nurse had listened patronizingly\nto the patient who had just been admitted to the nurse's office.

"I want to see my daughter again..."
"I'm sure you'll be able to see her soon,"
said the nurse, flashing a polite smile
while injecting the arm of the patient who lay in the bed.
The nurse knew all about the patient's daughter.\nAfter all, just days earlier, the nurse had injected her with the same medicine.

The people say it is a type of ghost.
Most of the sightings occur on the night of the new moon,
but the reason for this is not known.
The most convincing explanation so far is that the "ghost"
is actually the light of far-off lanterns.

It emerges from the darkness and just stands there in front of you.
It doesn't do anything but stand there,
and stare at you with its vacant eyes. 
Dawn breaks, and the sun sets again,
and still it stands there silently.

You even see it standing there in your dreams.
There is only one way to break free from it:
death.
By suicide, by accident, by any other way.
How you die doesn't matter. Death is the only way out.

And when you die, it quietly goes away.
Then, on the next new moon, it appears before someone else.
And it only appears to people who know the story.

Now that you know, you may be next.
[Dear Santa]\nThe present you gave me last year didn't last very long. This year, I want a present I can play with much longer.
I want a present I can keep playing with, even when I put it in a bag, toss it down the chimney, and burn it.
Ooh, I've got an idea.\nThis year, I want you for x-mas, Santa!\nWe're gonna have sooo much fun!
Sounds like a plan / Sounds like a plan\nPlease circle one of the above.
[To Parrah and Noya]\nSomeone is going around telling kids you're the ones who really bring the presents.
We need to seal the source of the enemy's power as soon as possible. On my justice, I swear to protect your secret.
That's not our only problem. No one's writing letters. How are we supposed to know what they want?
I was finally able to negotiate with Cinderella. This year's x-mas will be a peaceful one...perhaps.

"You really look like a girl, don't you?"
My father-in-law, reeking of alcohol, drew near my face, all while patting me on the butt.
He was a total tyrant. Unable to resist, I gave myself up to his violations of my body.
After the deed was done, he spoke.
"Be wary of the dark when entering the forest. No one who has heard the sound of wings flapping has returned. How about it? Feel a little wiser now?"

Some days later, I went into the forest with my father-in-law to fell some trees.
Around noon, he sat on a stump and began eating his lunch.
Excusing myself to take care of some business, I took my leave and began running with all my might deeper into the forest.
I had driven all trivial details from my mind. I couldn't stand to be with such a vulgar man any longer.

As I loitered around, it gradually began to grow dark.
My father-in-law's words of caution—"Be wary of the dark when entering the forest"—came to mind, causing a shiver to go down my spine.
"Hey! I'm not gonna let you get away!"
Hearing an angry voice calling out to me, I quickly turned around. With a look of a demon about him, my father-in-law had come chasing after me.
Just then, the sound of flapping wings drew near...

Huh? What happened after that you ask?
I gave up my feeble body and mind to the overwhelming darkness.
My father-in-law? Hmph, who knows.
All living things are nothing more than tiny specs of mold growing on the surface of the planet, after all.
Since I have become one with mother darkness, I don't want to trouble my mind with such trivial matters. I have, for the first time in my life, found peace.
An eye for an eye.\nA tooth for a tooth.\nCrimes must be met with punishment.

The one who perpetrates the crime
is the one who must be punished.
You say you're innocent?
Have you ever heard of collective responsibility?

If you find a bunch of ants eating up a house,
it's logical to destroy their nest, wouldn't you say?
Considering that the innocent eggs and larva
will cause trouble once they become adults,
it's more efficient to destroy them in their entirety.

This world...
It's full of irrationality, inequality,
and misfortune.
So, someone, somewhere has purported a crime.
Because of that, you're going to be punished.

Father, please hear out my confession.
But, before that… There's no fear that what I say here will leak to the outside, is there?
Oh, good. I'll take reassurance that my secret won't get out, then.
Actually… Actually, I killed my brother with my very own hands!

Why did I kill him, you ask?\nWell, that's because his fiancee was my private tutor. I had loved her for far longer than him.\nI had him take sleeping pills. I then closed him up in his room, and set fire to some charcoal set on a plate. I made my brother's murder look like a suicide.

After my brother died, that woman spent her days in tears.
I stayed by her side, consoling her with all my might, making her heart mine.
We were finally married, but were completely unable to have a child, leaving our relationship to grow more and more sour by the day…
Perhaps it was my brother's curse…

As I was preparing the Mass, a nun spoke.
She said the man who had come to repent yesterday had been shot dead.
And then I remembered. Yesterday, I could feel someone's presence outside the window of the confessional booth.
The wife had eavesdropped on the husband, and had resolved to kill him, leading her to commit this crime…!
I'm the only one who knows this secret, so I'll be the next one killed. I need to escape quickly…!
H-hey, y-you're…! W-wait! Hear me ou–
"Dear Santa"\nI'm sorry. When someone suddenly tells me to pick out a present, I'm not sure how to. So, I don't worry about me. I don't need a present.
That, or whatever my staff wants, I'll have that since I'm indebted to it. Just ask it.
Or, I'd like your clothes, Santa.
Oh, but everyone's going to have to wear swimsuits again next year. Maybe I can give them warm clothes so they don't catch a cold. Sorry, I guess I'm no good at deciding after all.
Am I stupid wanting to send her chocolates even though I know she won't get them?
Am I stupid to believe that love is more than a card and a candy heart?
Am I stupid because I despaired of my helplessness and went crying to my friends?
Am I stupid to because I finally lost my nerve and just ate the chocolates myself?
One day, the young queen passed away. Not long after, the king died too.\nPeople whispered that the king had read the diary left behind by the dead queen and killed himself in despair.

What was written in the queen's diary? Rumors spread through the kingdom like wildfire.\nThe queen had been a young woman when the couple was wed.\nHer beauty had been legendary in the town, and one day the king, who was strolling the streets in disguise, had seen her and immediately fallen head over heels.

At the time, the queen had had a lover, and while reluctant to give the king her hand, at her parent's urging, she had agreed to the wedding.\nSo the people gossiped that the diary must have had nasty things to say about the king.

After the king's death, the queen's diary, which he had kept under lock and key, was read by a few members of the royal family.\nThe queen had written not a word about the king. From the day they met, to the wedding day, to the days they spend together, not a single, solitary word...

There once was a ninja called the Gray Wing, a shadowy, chameleon-like figure who would slink unnoticed into his enemies' midst.\nThe Gray Wing may have been a dreaded adversary, but he was not a god.\nDriven into a corner by the king's security force, left with nowhere to run, he set himself on fire and burned to a crisp.

Following the Gray Wing's death, confidential information about him continued leaking out little by little, and the security force began doubting themselves.\nNo one knew the Gray Wing's true identity. So how could they be sure the man who had burned himself to a crisp was truly the Gray Wing?

The security forces panicked.\nEvery trifling incident seemed to them to be the Gray Wing's doing. They were jumping at shadows.\nAny one of them could be the Gray Wing, they realized. Nerves frayed, they could not let their suspicions rest.

The king went pale when he heard the reports.
For some unknown reason, the men of the security force had begun killing one another.
The few survivors had life-threatening injuries.
The people came to call this gruesome incident "The Gray Wing's Revenge." No one ever found out for sure if the Gray Wing was alive or dead.

What does a craftsman keep in mind when making an instrument?
The timbre, and the way the instrument sounds when played.
That goes without saying.
But some instruments are different.
For instance, this one, which was forged from steel.

The ties between war and music go back to ancient times.
For example, songs and dances have been used to pray for victory.
And music has been used to accompany marches.
Music is a necessary part of war.
And that's what this instrument was made for.

Pluck the strings of this harp,
and it makes a sound like a heroic warrior drawing a stiff bow.
Play it normally, of course,
and its clear tone resounds through the battlefield.
Needless to say, it is solidly built to withstand abuse in battle.

But its forte is the music of the battlefield itself.
The sound of arms clashing, flesh slicing, metal clanging.
Break a bone with it, and its strings ring out in sympathy.
The sound will shake you to your bones and make you want to scream.
Let's just say it has a reputation for making a racket.

A blade unearthed from the wasteland.
Too big to be called a sword, too heavy to fight with, too ugly to be cermonial.
What was it for?
It left the archaeologists scratching their heads.

When they researched the site where the blade was dug up, and referenced documents from the same time period,
they came upon a story about the blade.
The knight who had owned the blade
had single-handedly wiped out two whole enemy kingdoms.

They analyzed the blade to find out what it was made of, and to their surprise,
they found it contained not only steel, but also human blood and bits of bone.
The archaeologists believed the blade had been made of the weapons and bodies of dead men,
to serve as a warning against war.

War broke out, and the archaeologists found out the tale was true.
The knight appeared in the storeroom where the blade was kept, exactly as the ancient documents described him.
He claimed to represent the legion of souls that resided in the sword.
They would never rest, explained the knight, until humanity realized the foolishness of war.
My name is the Black Book. Are you the king who will lead the world to salvation? Don't be so surprised, Your Majesty. For me, it is a simple matter to speak human words.

I sympathize with your distress, Your Majesty. On this occasion, however, we have no choice but to let them deal with your sister. When sorrow overtakes you, you may come to me and speak of your tribulations.
Reading is an admirable pursuit. Your Majesty—for me?? I shall peruse this volume if it comes on your recommendation... What is that? You think it odd for a book to read a book?

Noir? I would prefer to dispense with this nickname. My name, Your Majesty, is the Black Book. I am a grand tome of human wisdom... thus, to refer to me by such a curious moniker is, dare I say, inappropriate.

The people in the church murmured prayers, their eyes fixed on an ominous stone carving of a bull's head. A solemn atmosphere hung over the chapel. The worshipers were praying to select a sacrifice to offer to god. Following a long silence, the priest announced the sacred mandate: a shy young girl would serve as the sacrifice. Tears streamed down her cheeks as the priest let her down a corridor into the inner sanctum.

The crowd filed out, and silence settled again over the chapel. A boy stood there in a daze. He had been the childhood playmate of the girl who had been chosen as the sacrifice, and he had always had a crush on her. She was so shy, so quiet, and he was determined to watch over her. He could never forget the memory of her smiling face, which she had shown to him alone. After making sure the coast was clear, the boy crept into the inner sanctum.

At the end a dimly lit corridor, the boy spied a light on inside a room. He peeked in and saw the girl all alone, crying. The boy took her hand, and they ran from the church. It's okay, it's okay, I'll never leave you, he gently assured her as she sobbed, shoulders heaving. But the girl did not respond. She just hung her head, mumbling beneath her breath.\n

The girl's voice gradually got louder and finally turned to screams. "God, at last, you've chosen me! Give me all your love, more and more and more and more and..." As tears of joy streamed down her face, she drew out the sharp bull's horn she had secreted away and stabbed herself in the heart. The bloodstained bull's horn gleamed vividly, looking almost alive. \n

The man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, but nothing could bring him to his knees. He was an immortal warrior. He wasn't gifted with any special physical ability, so if he weren't immortal, how could he have made it through?

The man had been immortal since he crossed paths with a small, beautiful bird one fateful day. Moved by the man's devotion to his wife, the bird had said to him, holding out a feather, "Carry this feather with you, and you will live to see your loved one again."

When the war ended, the man collected his payment and returned to live with his wife in the village. They lived in such poverty he couldn't even afford clothes for his wife. Nonetheless, his love for her gave him a reason to live.

Once again, the man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, and he fell down dead. That very day, back in the village, the man's wife had gone to a merchant and sold his beloved beautiful bird feather.

Flames swallowed the house, leaping up as if to burn the black night sky. The boy barely escaped, but his father, his mother, his siblings, and everything he owned went up in flames. All the boy was left with was a battleaxe the bandits had left behind, and the burn marks on his body. He waited for the wounds to heal, cursing the gods for condemning him to this fate.

The boy grew up to be a man, but still the burns did not heal. He tried all types of medicine, but there seemed to be no hope of recovery. Each time he brushed away the maggots gnawing on the scars, the pain would flare back up, and he would sink into a foul mood. Searching for a way to forget the pain, the young man joined a band of mercenaries. He realized that the moment his sword descended on an enemy, then and only then did the pain ease. He had finally found an escape from his suffering.

Hired to fight in a conflict with a neighboring kingdom, the mercenaries laid waste to an enemy village. The young man wildly swung the battleax, determined to force his pain on others, to drown his suffering in the murderous ecstasy of war. He burst inside a home, beheaded the father as he pleaded for his life, hacked the mother's body to bits while shouting curses, and tossed the baby into the burning stove. For a short time, he forgot the pain of the burns.

Swept up in the ecstasy of slaughter, he lit fire to the room where the corpses lay, just for fun. On his way out, he spied a young girl standing near the burning home, crying. The moment he laid eyes on her, he remembered the fire of his youth that had taken everything from him, and the pain of the burn wounds flared up. Understanding there was only one way to end this suffering, he lit himself on fire, and handed the bloodstained battleax to the girl.
The king sung the praises\nof the eternal kingdom and the sun that would never set.
The queen sung the praises\nof the great king and his marvelous achievements.
The prince sung the praises\nof the staunchly loyal soldiers, always marching forward.
The jester just sung a song,\nridiculing the three members of the royal family who had rested on their laurels and met their doom.
She was slender, with smooth, white skin.\nThe hint of a dark shadow in her expression highlighted her beautiful features.\nBut something about the sword in her hand didn't seem to fit the picture.
Anger, sorrow, hatred.\nWhen emotions overwhelmed her, she would swing the sword, so there was never a lack of blood to quench its thirst.\nThe problem was that she couldn't put the sword down.
A heart and body in constant conflict.\nNo one in the world could understand her.\nAnd loneliness was eating her alive.
The long war came to an end, and darkness devoured her.\nBut her heart remained at peace.\nBecause she faced fate in the arms of the one she loved.

File_25_10: Update
Soon twins will be arriving.
There is nothing at all in the white-walled, prison-like room except for a white bed.
If only there were something to do in there...

File_25_12: Update
I went to look in on them, and the girl was kindly encouraging her anxious younger brother.
The two of them had heavy expectations to fulfill.
The weight of all humanity's hope bore down upon them.

File_26_06: Update
The day of the experiment, the girl passed me a letter.
To the very end, she wanted someone to watch over her brother.
Once I agreed, she quickly ran away.

Report: Human Weapon Development
Things seem to be progressing as expected with Experimental Subject A (Sister), but her condition has changed drastically.
In her present state, she seems to have no sense of self.
I am urgently beginning work on Experimental Subject B (Brother).

----------------------------
Dear Popola,

Thanks for that soup recipe! My mom loved it!
----------------------------
A note received from a child in the village. Does this mean they are developing a sense of self?

－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
Dear Popola,

Thanks to the medicine you gave me, I'm feeling a lot better, though I can't leave home yet. Just sending a note to say thanks.
－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
According to our records, humans wrote their feelings down on pieces of paper, and sent them to others. Where did they learn to do such a thing?

－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
Dear Popola,

I like you a lot. Will you be my girlfriend? Waiting to hear back.
－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
I simply cannot understand the things they have written on these scraps of paper. I feel an unfamiliar feeling, my heart saying "no"…

－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
Dear Popola,

Sorry I couldn't tell you in person, but I'm coming home late tonight. Go ahead and sleep if you're tired.
－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－
Ah, Devola. No need to worry about me this way. Tee-hee.
We fought for what seemed like ages.\nTo kill those things that took a twisted human form.\nTo protect those precious to me, with my own hands.
We were deceived for so long.\nDeceived by people in a land we've never been, whose faces we've never seen\nIssuing orders from a safe distance.
We must have been in love.\nAnd despite the fact I couldn't save you,\nbut I never got to thank you for saving me.

These fragments glimmering deep in my depths...
they seem to be the vague memories of people...
the faded remnants of human wisdom...

H-hold on! I'll have you know my name is not "Booky Wooky!"
You may call me "Grimoire Weiss" I am a great compendium of ancient wisdom.
Treat me with respect!

"The marshmallows are ready!"
Dorothy held out a marshmallow she had roasted on a stick.
Careful not to burn my tongue, I nibbled on the lining crispy layer first, before biting down on the gooey center. It instantly melted in my mouth.

"I burnt it again..."
Looking over, I saw Sleeping Beauty struggling to toast her marshmallow to a perfect brown.
"It's okay. I can eat it like this."
Peeling off the burnt bits, I popped the rest of it in my mouth. If only she were more awake, she'd look more her age.

"They taste even better smooshed between crackers!"
The crisp texture from the crackers combined with sweet chocolate added a new sensation. After a sip of black coffee, I caught myself smiling.
"The Three Little Pigs would probably enjoy this." Wiping the chocolate from the corner of Sleeping Beauty's mouth, I began to plan our next camping trip.

The annoying morning chirps of the birds woke me up.
I rubbing my sleepy eyes, I tip-toed around the snoozing Alice and out of the tent.

The scent of last night's fire lingered in the air.
I could hear the murmur of a river of in the distance. The tree's branches swayed in the wind.
I wanted to sleep a little longer, but this is just as relaxing.

I took in deep breaths, as if breathing new life into me.
Mornings like this aren't so bad.
It's rather pleasant.

"Waking up in the morning is kinda nice."
My words were quickly followed by an exaggerated yawn.
"Yaaawn... A nap sounds better though."
I smiled imagining Alice shaking her herself awake.

A small light flickered in the pitch-black world.
The flame danced in the gentle breeze. Gentle, yet mesmerizing.

Outdoor grilling is another special experience.
The aroma of the smoke and the charcoal flavoring adds a unique taste making the trip worthwhile.

"...But that not all there is."
The two girls looked back at me with calm expressions. While not quite as apparent, it was a warmer expression than usual.

"It's almost like magic."
Camping is fun no matter what you do. Ordinary moments turn into special memories.
Realizing this, the red-haired scientist turned the magic of camp into her new obsession.

I'm just your run-of-the-mill girl.
Who I'm really proud of is my big sister. She's beauty who turns everyone's heads. Not to mention. she's our lord's girlfriend.
What a dashing and wonderful man he is, too. Oh, how I envy you, Sis.

I was walking absentmindedly down a path in the forest with my little sister.
Was our sis abandoned because he found a gold digger? Did he strangled her because she threw a fit?
No... I'll have him pay for this!

The Witch of thh Dark Woods said to me: "You wish to be my apprentice, eh? Are you prepared to walk the fires of hell?"
Years later, I became a witch. And with my new powers I summoned demons to attack our lord.
After capturing him, I clenched my sword with all my might and killed him.

One day I had finally found a good man and was wed. But he found another woman.
Just when I had proof of the affair, I was poisoned.
When my sister learns of this truth, surely she will take the same path as me and seek revenge.
Th-that's right... The fires of hell will destroy the cause of death. Please before... I'm burned...
Does this outfit suit a warrior of Justice?\nAs long as it's what everyone wishes...
Thank you for your support.\nI didn't think I'd live to see the day.
I only hope this won't be the last time I'm presented such an award. Until then, I will greatly honor this moment.
...Surely my chances are slim towards setting a record next year.

That day was like any other day. The dawn of a new day.
The house was usually full of rustle and bustle, but today it was quiet. Too quiet.
That morning, a single gunshot flew straight through the window casting a warning.
And for that house, the day never begun. Not that day, nor the next, nor the day after that. Never again.

The neighbors of that house thought the owner to be a nuisance for years. He began his mornings in the loudest manner possible. Then one day he was shot in the forehead by the first shot that signaled the start of the day.

Decorative Material: Unknown mineral
Usage: To store alcoholic beverages

Magic Effect 1: Preserves current state\nMagic Effect 2: Atomic conversion of contents (into alcohol)\nRemarks: Any object inside this flask can be converted into liquor. Time needed for conversion is inversely proportion to the magical strength of the contents.

Additional Research: Conversion of water into an alcoholic beverage
Object: Water
Conversion Period: 1 day
Taste: Thirst-quenching, refreshing
Remarks: Types of water have may have varying flavors. Additional research is required.

Additional Research 2: Conversion of body fluids into alcoholic beverages
Object: Blood
Conversion Period: 3 days
Taste: Mellow and rich. Slightly addictive.
Remarks: Taste varies on age and sex of the donor and condition of blood.
Rumors have begun to spread about a vampire. Further research is temporarily abandoned.

[Group] Vanguard Weapon
[Attack Type] Magic

[Wielder's Voice]
Multiple targets are better than one!
Not to mention all the pluses to parameters!
But why are these magic attacks?
[xxx Note]\nShouldn't this be a physical weapon?\n(*It is what it is.)

[Traits]\nA weapon in the form of a staff.\nDepending on the staff, can heal one or multiple allies.

[Wielder's Voice]
I want to support my friends from the sidelines.
But it's really hard to time it just right!
I began dating one of the girls I healed and next month we're getting married.
[xxx Note]\nA staff isn't very original.\n(*It is what it is.)

[Group] Rearguard Weapon
[Attack Type] None

[Wielder's Voice]
Now I can watch my friends beat the crap out of enemies! With my help!
Nothing to brag about, but still an important role.
Besides, since I failed at becoming a real musician, this is close enough.
[xxx Note]\nAll these buffs are a bit overwhelming if you ask me.\n(*Unbuff skills have been added.)

[Antique Bookstore Owner]
Welcome! Oh? What do you have there?
There's some kind of mud all over your book.
Huh? It's slime?
Well whatever, same thing!

Are you here to sell this?
I'm not saying you came to the wrong place or nothin'. We do buy antique books.
Just keep in mind it might not be worth all that much.
So then, how much are we askin' for the sticky thing?
Mind tellin' me what the book's about?\n...You dunno? Come on, it's your book, ain't it?\nHaven't you read it?

Huh? Rimuru used this book?!
Well I'll be damned!
This is a national treasure!
I take it all back! I'll buy it at any price!!!

[Cleaning Staff]
I work in the cleaning business.
Most of the time I'm asked to tidy up houses or just pick up trash in the streets.
It's a good thing there's not many litterbugs in this country, but someone still has to rake up all the leaves and stuff.

So here I was, raking up leaves deep in the forest when I came across something.
That something? This sword.
The whole thing was on fire.
Like, that's not normal...right?

Anyway, so I brought the thing back into town.
Before I knew it, word had gotten out about this thing, and ya know what happened next?
Rimuru himself came to see me in person.
The very moment he saw the blade, he had this sad look of nostalgia in his eyes...
I can only imagine how important it was to him.

Rimuru took the sword with him when he left.
Sometime after that, I found the sword again, this time lodged in front of a stone monument.
Unlike before, there were no flames.
I wonder if its related to the person buried below?

[Street Booth Owner]
You'd be surprised to hear what that girl is really like.
When she's with us she's no stranger to cooking and sewing.
On top of that, her friendly personality attracts all sorts of people.

At times I wish she was my own daughter.
I've even joked about it a few times.
It's become a habit to invite her over. She never complains, in fact, she seems pleased to help...
Oh, I'm going off track.

But that's the truth.
The problem is she's the princess of the ogre clan.
She's much stronger than any of us could hope to be.
The first time I saw her with that wand of hers, I was awestruck.

There was a gang of hoodlums who invaded the country. With a flick of her wand and they dropped on the spot.
Later I asked her what she did to them, and you know what she said? She used a spell to put them to sleep.
It's no wonder she's a close friend of Rimuru's.
Is there any man out there worthy of such a woman?
Marriage is all we seem to talk about recently.

[Wandering Child]
Woah, what is this?
Is it a toy? It's really cool.
It's not stealing if I found it, right?

Ugh! Why is it so heavy?
At least I got something cool to play with now!
How do I use with it anyway?
Oh! Maybe if I look through this hole I'll find something in there.

Just as I was looking through the hole, someone grabbed the toy from me!
It was a pink-haired girl with pigtails.
I've seen her plenty of times before. Oh, what was her name... Oh yeah! Milim!
My parents warned me not to get upset around her.
Is she that scary?

"You're 100 years too young to handle my gun!"
Milim took the toy off me and handed me candy instead.
"A token of my thanks. I was looking for this!"
I popped the candy she gave me in my mouth. It was sweet.
I don't know about my parents, but Milim seems okay to me.

● asked God, "What is that there?"
God replied, "Those red fruits on the tree are apples."
It was then ● learned the word 'apple.'
● took a bite of the apple. It smelled fresh and sweet.
● then began their search for more apples.

It was later that ● met △ and shared an apple with them.
△ seemed to like it.
One day when △ found an apple, the Devil said to △, "Why share your apple with ● when you can have it all to yourself?"
And so, △ ate the entire apple themself.

The Devil then went to ● and told them what △ had done.
For the very first time ● learned how to kill people with the sword in their hand.
Red dripped down from the blade. Was this an apple?
The Devil replied to ●'s question with a 'no.'
Then what about △'s red stained xx? The Devil said that was an apple.

● took a bite of △'s apple.
When God found out about this, he disappeared in grief.
With God gone, the Devil bounded ● to the earth and named them "man".
And in return, ● called the Devil "God" for teaching them many things.
After treating an injured demon from the sea, he gave me a splendid bow.\nWhen I drew the bow back as if ready to shoot, the waters pulled back. And when I released it, a surge of waves raged in.

The first shot destroyed a mountain. The second engulfed my village. And the third shot aimed right for the sky.\nUpon that last shot, it down poured for many days; the rainwater sweeping away everything.

It was then that I met the demon again. He laughed at me, asking if I was trying to destroy the world.\nI smiled and wrapped my arms around him.\nAll I wanted was to become your bride and make all the souls of the world my bridesmaids.
What was I to do? I cared deeply for my friends and family in my village, but I had fell in love with a demon. I had made my decision.\nSo, please. In the name of love, die. Everyone, die for me.

Hey! How about you treat me with more respect?
That's right, I'm talking to you.
You gotta be more gentle with me unlike those other magical items.
Don't use crude magic or leave me lying around.
Heh? Agh, wait! Don't be waving me around like that either!

Are you listening?! What the heck are you doing?!
You don't use wands to hit monsters!
What do you mean you're bad at magic?!
...Don't look at me like that. Stop it! Cut it out!

...Let's talk about this, okay?
You're a wizard, and I'm a wand.
We gotta work together, you know?
But that doesn't mean you can just smack me against a monster. How about we have a little heart-to-heart and make some magic toget...AAAAGHHR!!!

What is that war hammer?!
That's called cheating, you know! What do you need that for when you have me?!
How dare you! You're outta your mind if you think I'll forgive you for this!
...Oh. You're just friends? Sorry, I misunderstood.
Well, off to crack the skull of another monster today!

Upon hearing the dreadful news, my heart raced even faster.
I couldn't believe that my father's ship had been wrecked.
On top of that, the location of its wreck is home to some of the most dangerous marine animals, including sharks.
I was almost taken by despair until hearing one survivor had been found. It gave me some hope.

I was met with disappointment when I arrived at the hospital. The man in the bed was of my father's age, but it wasn't him.
I asked him about my father, but the man didn't know him.
But there on the table next to him, I caught sight of a harp. And my blood began to boil.
"That was my father's harp! Why do you have it?!"

"Please, calm down. I'll talk," the man said.
He then went on to tell of him and my father clinging onto a plank together while adrift at sea.
As they drifted, they came upon a creature barely alive and devoured.
"And then we merged into one..."

I was astonished. The man had changed into my father.\n"I came from outer space, but then collided with a ship from this planet. It caused a great loss of body tissue as a result. So I let those two devour me, linking them to my internal universe to keep me alive. Now it's your turn."\nThe being resembling my father clutched my arm and chuckled.

Oh, dear Father. Please save your lost lamb.\nAs a fisherman, I spend most of my days out at sea. But for a few days now, out of nowhere I hear the voices of lost souls. It's rather troubling to say the least.
What was the soul saying, you ask?\nWell, that depends.\nSometimes it's somethin' trivial like philosophy n' other times it's vulgar. But I won't go there.
Have I heard from God himself?\nHm, that's a tough one. I guess I've heard some things kinda holy n' stuff.\nBut who's to say.

Oh, dear Father! Why must you lock me away?!\nKeh?! What'dya mean I'm the chosen one? Jus' 'cause I can hear things don't mean I hear the voice of God too, let alone have responsibility in makin' you my disciple!\nN-no! Please let me out of here!

[Hot-blooded Young Monk]
My Lord! The Son of Man is a sinful creature jealous of thy neighbor, longing for thy failure, and drags thyself down!
I too am at times devastated by these ugly souls.
Please protect our hearts from such jealously!

[Pure Young Monk]
My Lord! Tis been ten years since man has been freed from all jealousy!
We no longer have reason to envy others.
Oh, how different the world appears. Such beauty! Full of light and hope!

[Peaceful Adult Monk]
My Lord! How long has it been since we've rid ourselves of envy?
Here on Earth, the people don't fight. They greet each other with smiles and kindness.
Isn't this world just as wonderful as your heavenly paradise?

[Sorrowful Elder Monk]
We live in a world of peace.
But within our conservative lives dwells an air of impatience.
There aren't many people remaining nowadays. They've gradually dwindled away.
My Lord! I pray that you return our jealousy to us! I cannot leave this world until it's been fulfilled!

[Blacksmith's Apprentice]
Welcome to the Weapon Shop! How may I help you?
Oh, this spear here? Sorry, it's not for sale.
Again, I appreciate your interest in it, but we aren't selling it. Not even to the highest bidder.
But you're right. It is a very special weapon indeed.

There was a woman I fell for. It was love at first sight. And this spear was forged just for her.
She was the most beautiful woman I had ever seen. I could tell there was a dark side to her, but even that swept me away...
The two horns on her forehead meant she's a member of the ogre clan.
But this spear... I made it with her in mind. Oh, how wonderful it would be if she were to wield it.

My only regret is that I failed to ask her name.\nNot like I could have. The moment she appeared I was running away from a monster. I thought I was about to die.\nBut if I ever see her again, I'm going to offer her this spear and ask her out! I won't miss a second chance!

What? What do you mean she left?
Where did she leave to? Is she not a resident here?
No... I can't bear to let this go unrequited.
She was my muse! My Juliet!
If only I could have given her this spear and seen her smile once last time.

[Tailor's Daughter]
One of my hobbies is to make dolls out of the scraps from work.
I design them myself.
Have you heard of personification?
I like to imagine what a low-grade demon would be like as a person.

So, that's what I do. I take that image in my head and turn it into a real live doll!
I used to get strange looks from people when they saw my creations, but when Rimuru saw them, he cheered me up.
You see... He gave all my dolls a name.
...I'm grateful for it, but at the same time its a bit dispiriting.

Low-class demons don't come to this country, so there's really no point to my fantasies.
I felt really sad about it.
But then just the other day, one finally showed up!
Guess what kind it was?!
A slime! Not strong slime like Rimuru, but a real low-class slime!

After meeting that slime, I came up with a new creation! Which is this doll here!
I named it Snowy because it's white like the snow.
What do you think? Cute, right?
Me and Slimy Snowy are going to be best friends!
The night he got the book with the octopus on the cover, he began to see visions of the city sinking to the bottom of the sea.\nSoon it would be all that he could think about.

Once upon a time there was a giant alien invertebrate that came to the planet and fought with its native species for control.\nThe city the aliens and their families built as their base ultimately submerged.
Those who worshiped the giant invertebrates as a god plotted a way to resurrect them.\nPart of their plan was to create a spell book that possessed those who read it and gather more followers.
It wasn't long after that he was possessed by this octopus god, and was never seen from again...

What do you mean you want me to send a false report that our rations haven't arrived?!\nTough it up! We're the most powerful iron-blooded knights to walk this continent! So what if we're being held captive!\nTh-That's a big hammer you got there. If you're going to crush my left arm, so be it.
Heh... Heheheh. I-I'm fine. See? Just a little sting, is all.\nI don't need my left arm. I've still got my right!\nHuh? Now my right arm, you say?

Okay! Okay! I'll shout that 'the enemy has taken our provisions and we'll surrender unless given help.' How does that sound?\nOh, you have something special for me for opposing you? There's a lovely nurse waiting for me below?\nI'll be off then!

Damn bastard! How dare you tell the guard to wait for the rearguard's arrival!\nThanks to you, the enemy is on the move again! We lost our best chance at overtaking their fort!\nBut out of respect for your loyalty in giving up your arms, we'll be sure to give you a proper burial.

I, musician and husband of a priestess, set out to appease the Underworld.\nOnly the dead may enter its dark depths, but by playing the tune of "Elegy of the Underworld", I am able to set foot unharmed.\nLearning this tune was not an easy feat. Remembering my days of study under my many masters, I continued onward.

Having completed my mission, I returned to the world of the living. But what awaited me was a world stricken by a terrible plague.
Along with the suffering was my wife, with no hope of survival.
I did what I could to nurse her back to health.
Perhaps it was the guilt I felt for leaving her behind. For the loneliness I caused her while out on my journey.

Since my body had died once upon descending into the Underworld, I was immune to the effects of the plague.\nOne after the other, I watched all those around me die. It was then the time of my wife's own death.\nShe whispered something to me...and with that she passed on.

"I knew of your determination to write a magical melody. Otherwise you wouldn't have studied amongst many masters and practiced long into the night."\n"That is why I performed a miracle, and spread this disease across the land. To make it a place suited for melodies of gloom. So enjoy!"\nThe last remaining, I wander alone. Staring at the void above me, unintelligible words escaping my lips.

I'm a nerd, plain and simple.
I'm considered a nuisance, pretty much invisible in any group I join.
But there was this book. A rare edition that I needed to have.
So I hurried to the secondhand shop and stole it.

"What a read!" I turn each page excitedly, fatigue failing to succumb me.
The best part of the story was what happened after the main character, The Phoenix, awoke from his dream.
He beat those bullies to a pulp and even burned down the school!
This book gives me the courage to live!

Wait...no! Anything but that!
Why...Why did you rip my book?!
"All you do is read. No woman wants to date a creep living in a fantasy world."
You... All of you! You'll pay for this one day! I swear!

I'm reminded of an old banned-book that depicted a school burning to the ground. The students and faculty all dead.\nIt received attention as the main character, The Phoenix, burned down his school out of revenge for bullying he endured.\nI was lucky to read it before it was banned, though I earnestly debated whether to set my own school aflame.

Listen, my son. Today our excavations uncovered the tomb of a certain king.\nWe believe he was a man of virtue as there were tear jars, an amount greater than that was ever seen before. However, no record could be found of this.\nWhat a perfect opportunity! If I uncover the truth behind this king and present it to the academy, I can reclaim my position!

Listen, my son. Digging deeper into records, I've discovered this king's country was governed with injustice.\nI've become fully invested in unraveling the truth. It's quite possible that history had been falsified and his name stigmatized for future historians.\nWe'll see who gets the last laugh now! I'll show those fools how wrong they were about me!

Listen, my son. Since my discovery, I've been researching extensively and referring to experts. However, the accepting that history had been fabricated seemed unthinkable to them.\nI find this hard to believe, considering the sheer amount of tear jars at his grave. There must be more to this mystery. Some missing piece to the puzzle.\nWatch me, my son! Your father is going to make the greatest discovery the world has ever seen!

Hm? What is a tear jar, you ask?
It was once customary for attendees to place their tears in a jar at the funeral as a burial gift. Hence its name.
Oh? You think perhaps those jars are tears of joy, celebrating the end of his awful reign?
My, that's a ridiculous thought! Watch, my son! For I won't forgive this world for their unkindness towards me!

The girl is a blessing from God.
She feasts on fruit and drinks the blood of saints.
O' she who devours the flesh of her followers.
She who has descended from the heavens.
Please bestow us with your oracle!

Child without sin, child without wisdom.
Untainted by the world, innocent virgin.
I ask thy forgiveness as I serve you and only you.
I have defiled myself to protect your innocence.

The day you came into this world, I removed both your parents and doctor.
All that needs to be done, I have done for you.
You needn't learn a thing.
Child of God, even speech is beyond you.
Neither good nor evil resides inside you.\nThat is why I give my all to you.\nShall you, who lives pure and ignorant, utter a single word...that would be the oracle.

"I'd give my life to protect my country."\nThose words are all it takes to gain the trust of your superiors and earn the praise of those around you. Is it not?\nJust look at this huge sword I got. And I accomplished nothing of importance to get it.

To be honest, I wish I never got it.
I'm not as strong as the others, so I suck at swinging it.
Plus, if the enemy catches sight of me, I'll be mistaken as the top fighter and get targeted by the group.
I'm not a fighter. Just someone who likes to talk big.
Damn, did I mess up.

So then I got to thinking.
What can I use this huge sword for?
"When I perish on behalf of my country, I wish to have this sword, bestowed to me from the king, displayed next to my grave."
Yeah, I like the sound of that.

People will walk past my grave and think how honorable a swordsman I was.\nIt's decided then. I shall die the moment we engage in battle.\nI've gotten fed up with this whole fighting for my country act anyway.

Dear family, I'm home at last!
Haha! It's been ages since I've last seen my comrades from the knighthood, I've lost track of time.
Just a bunch of old men now with nothing to do but nag. But their hearts remain full of youth!
Eh? Must I go to sleep now?

Those boys sent me armor from our days in the knighthood.\nAh, the good o' days. Days of wielding my club and the fervor of adolescence.\nOh! My wife and son have returned. Eh? Stop playing around and help with the housework?
There's no end to the surprises! Those good fellas even sent me my favorite drink!\nWhat a fantastic way to end the day!\nEh? What do you mean you drank all of it?!

The man could no longer swallow his bitterness and mutilated the cause of it. He then called upon his old friends.\nEach of them pack a portion of the remains into a box and disposed of them individually without causing suspicion.\nTo hell with family! My buddies are all I need.

"And you call yourselves apprentices?! I need ingredients to make this potion! Get out and there and search, you frogs!"
Our master ordered us to scavenge the wilderness for ingredients.
As we, a group of us were caught by a ferocious wind, whipping them into the air.
Now what? I'm the only one left.

There standing where the winds clashed, was the Wind King.
He showed me no harm and instead wrapped me in a warm breeze, protecting me from the cold. What's more, he offered me food and water.
Though I could barely sense his presence, I was touched by his kindness.
I think...I might be in love.

"I can't go back. I'll only be put to work. Please, let me be your bride!"\nThe Wind King stayed by my side. I couldn't be happier.\nBut then my master, red in the face with anger, appeared flying on a broomstick. "Foolish apprentice! Come! It's time you returned!" I was then pulled aboard and off we flew.

Angered by this, gusts of fearsome winds roared in our direction. As a last resort, my master used magic to transport us.
It's been 10 years since then. I am now locked away as punishment for my behavior.
Whenever I feel a draft of wind coming from my prison's cracks, I wonder if it's the Wind King coming to rescue me. I get my hopes up only to feel despair minutes later.
But it's the only hope I have. The sound of the wind is what keeps me alive.

[Yusuf, the Innocent]\nDear Lord, please hear my wish! I'm in need of everlasting goods!\nI've done all I can, and still the orphans from the war continue to die! Please grant me wealth and abundance to save the lives of these children!

[Oliver, the Orphan]
Yusuf brought us so much food!
And he's gonna build a big, strong house too, he said!
I do miss my mama and papa... But I'm never sad when Yusuf's around!

[Randal, the Servant]
Yesterday was another night of debauchery.
He speaks of helping unprivileged children of the world, but the man's a hypocrite.
All he cares about is power and beautiful women. Everything is about him.

[Hartman, the Writer]\nMr. Yusuf had taken his own life with a sickle.\nBefore his death he told me, "I live in luxury and splendor. A life many can only dream to have. But I've lost my ability to walk on my own due to my weight and my own children are merely after my inheritance. I mistook life's greatest and everlasting treasure. That of unconditional love.
It's not as bad as I thought.\nAt first it felt tight, but the slits make it easier to move.
I don't care about fashion. But after wearing this, I might have grown a new appreciation for it.
How many more outfits will I wear?\nHow many times will I stain them in red?
Will it be my body or spirit that perishes first? The future is unknown.\nNo matter what happens, I won't forget the happiness I felt in this outfit.\nOr so I thought.
Like a little birdy, I'll continue to dance. Even if the one watching wishes for my death.
Another may see my dance as a prayer of blessings.\nBut my wish will not change.
I will pray, fight, and dance for my own sake. Even if my wish remains but a wish for all eternity.
Perhaps it is because I'm alone that it's never-changing. How about it? Would you like to dance with me?

[Disciple]
Thank you for taking me on as your disciple!
My older brother aspired to become a great flutist just like yourself!
He was a absolutely amazed by your skills, even your biggest fan!
Please, accept my gift.

[Disciple]
About my brother... He never had any talent.
That's why he respected you so much.
Oh, hang on. I'll go drop my things in my room.
Don't open the gift until I come back!

[Assistant]
Excuse me, sir? Who was that just now?
Oh! Your disciple? No, it should be someone else.
By the way, what's with that box there?
If it's a gift you should open—AH?!
N-no... You mustn't look, sir!

[Fake Disciple]
I told you not to open it.
You know, my brother was fascinated by you. You rejecting his request to learn from you sent him into despair. And then he killed himself.
I want to add your head to the collection of disciples and offer it to my brother's grave.
Isn't it fun? Oh, I can't wait to dance to the flute from the other world!

There once was a very popular circus elephant.
It could walk on a ball, draw, and shake hands with the audience. A very clever elephant indeed.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"You, my friend, are a star."

The circus is in full swing today.
In front of the audience's eyes is the clever elephant.
It walks on the ball, draws pictures, and shakes the audience's hands.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"Thank you for making this day spectacular."

The circus was out of customers.
No one cared about the elephant. It had become old news.
The elephant continued to work in the empty tent.
The circus leader looked into the elephant's eyes.
"It's okay. Don't be so hard on yourself."

With tears in his eyes, the leader said to the elephant, "I'm sorry. I'm unable to feed you anymore."
The elephant then got up on his ball and let out large roar. The leader's tears were that of joy.
"You really love the circus, don't you?"
Then the elephant trampled on his leader.

A crossbow, a national treasure of a certain kingdom, was capable of shooting two arrows.\nIt was rare and gorgeous, and could fire in two separate directions. This bow was handed down from generation to generation by the kings of the kingdom.\nHowever, one of the arrows went missing when the previous king gave birth to a heir.

The king had passed away and the crowned prince was to take the royal throne.
Before becoming the rightful heir, the prince searched for the lost arrow, but to no avail. And thus the coronation ceremony had arrived.
It was that day a man came to the palace with the lost arrow.
Without hearing him out, the prince seized the arrow and banished him.

The man who had brought the arrow was the son of the previous king.
He was the prince's twin, hidden away in a far off country by his father.
The king had to follow the lore of the crossbow, and thus had to send one of his sons away.
This secret was kept to preserve the king's lineage.

Years later the country was attacked and destroyed.
It was by the same man who had returned the missing arrow as revenge for the kindness he had offered.
The lore goes on to say that when these arrows are shot, they will one day return.
However, where they travel is unknown.

The rain poured down from the skies, it seemed the heavens would fall upon the earth. Unable to withstand the surge, Negra had finally collapsed.\nSensing an opportunity, I stole an expensive mallet and took off.
The mallet was incredibly heavy. It proved difficult to carry myself.\nBut I pushed on regardless.

Ducking into the darkness, I gazed upon the mallet's glow.
Oh, how beautiful it was.
And delicious... Chomp!
Oh, so sweet indeed.

Hm?
Why are these ants carrying candy canes?
How dare they indulge themselves when humans are here in poverty!
Ungrateful insects! I'm gunna crush you!
